commit_message:
FirstApp: Move source directory up, rename top-level dir

For the RST guides, we do not need doc/source, since doc is always
empty. Use source directly.

This syncs the setup used here with openstack-manuals.

Rename top-level from openstack-firstapp to firstapp, there's no need
for the long name in this repo.

Change-Id: If4e11a4f90d580876865348e0d88b92cec4b6659

subject: Fix RabbitMQ OCF stop/start actions
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-30 11:38:17.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nova/files/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Fix RabbitMQ OCF stop/start actions

W/o this fix, rabbitMQ OCF may hang on the stop or start
as it ignores the stop/wait commands exit code. This is an
issue as it prevents rabbit node from joining the cluster.

The solution is to report generic failure, if corresponding
commands timed out:
* Fix stop_server_process() timeout command exit code check.
* Fix try_to_start_rmq_app() timeout command exit code check.

Closes-bug: #1446190

Change-Id: I8a0ccdde88cbb4c8545427f5bd6bdca6856a4687
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1b553e823effcd14d59f42ec36852339d709e7a4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix RabbitMQ OCF stop/start actions

W/o this fix, rabbitMQ OCF may hang on the stop or start
as it ignores the stop/wait commands exit code. This is an
issue as it prevents rabbit node from joining the cluster.

The solution is to report generic failure, if corresponding
commands timed out:
* Fix stop_server_process() timeout command exit code check.
* Fix try_to_start_rmq_app() timeout command exit code check.

Closes-bug: #1446190

Change-Id: I8a0ccdde88cbb4c8545427f5bd6bdca6856a4687
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1b553e823effcd14d59f42ec36852339d709e7a4)

commit_message:
Fix RabbitMQ OCF stop/start actions

W/o this fix, rabbitMQ OCF may hang on the stop or start
as it ignores the stop/wait commands exit code. This is an
issue as it prevents rabbit node from joining the cluster.

The solution is to report generic failure, if corresponding
commands timed out:
* Fix stop_server_process() timeout command exit code check.
* Fix try_to_start_rmq_app() timeout command exit code check

Closes-bug: #1446190

Change-Id: I8a0ccdde88cbb4c8545427f5bd6bdca6856a4687
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1b553e823effcd14d59f42ec36852339d709e7a4)

commit_message:
Chnage the default IP_VERSION to 4

DevStack has been set to dual stack by default in Kilo+.
Therefore all tests are failing. Reverting to V4
for integration tests till we fix the templates.

Change-Id: I4a9e4b40d0a1d8dc4231b4331eef82508d0f22a8

commit_message:
Puppet/Beaker: drop puppet-{gnocchi,tuskar}

For now, Gnocchi and Tuskar are not packaged in Ubuntu so there is no
way to test the modules with Beaker Rspec.
Until we have the packages, let's drop the useless jobs from the CI.

Change-Id: I895e58d0ea1e8e2c61086a1e0024c411e31a9e63

subject: Remove mention of anti-virus scan
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-01 22:28:46.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_catalog/web/index.html'], 'message': 'Remove mention of anti-virus scan

Index page mentioned binary assets were being
scanned for viruses - this is not being practiced
consistently, and should not be mentioned. Removing
for now, and will eventually be replaced with
legal disclaimer indicating downloader is responsible
for determining safety and suitability of all assets.

Change-Id: I78693a6fe94e9173840e688e5b737c0cb78ab950
'}]
commit_message:
Remove mention of anti-virus scan

Index page mentioned binary assets were being
scanned for viruses - this is not being practiced
consistently, and should not be mentioned. Removing
for now, and will eventually be replaced with
legal disclaimer indicating downloader is responsible
for determining safety and suitability of all assets.

Change-Id: I78693a6fe94e9173840e688e5b737c0cb78ab950

commit_message:
Added field 'data' to cluster-policy bindings table

This table will be used by a policy to record per-binding data. Sample
use case include -- a policy that requires monitoring records alarm
resource IDs here for their lifecycle management; a load-balancing
policy records the resource of LB pool resource created.

Change-Id: I0ba28bb5cecbc95e5a33032dff9ce30618249ec5

commit_message:
Allow changing project-id and user-id by alarm-threshold-update

Ceilometer alarm-threshold-update should support updating
project-id and user-id, but the update function was silently
ignoring changes of these options.

Change-Id: I33231bff44b90f3c58e5ef1646349b6dc63a3ce7
Closes-Bug: 1395932

commit_message:
Add image name support when create a baymodel

Currently, if we create a baymodel and pass an image name as parameter,
an image not found exception would be raised.

This patch add image name support when create a baymodel

Closes-Bug: #1448952

Change-Id: If8b41eacccf0880908dafebb3e86e374399c0bef

The positional decorator provides a way to ensure that certain arguments
are passed as kwargs when specified. This provides some great advantages

keyword arguments.

Change-Id: I7f5b998c73884e590ab2e290fcdd84c006e1452c
'}]
commit_message:
Import positional decorator used by keystoneclient

The positional decorator provides a way to ensure that certain arguments
are passed as kwargs when specified. This provides some great advantages
in maintaining backwards compatibility as you can add new positional
arguments in front of existing keyword arguments, or rearrange existing
keyword arguments.

Change-Id: I7f5b998c73884e590ab2e290fcdd84c006e1452c

commit_message:
Add /usr/local/bin to exec_dirs in rootwrap.conf

devstack installs neutron utilities into /usr/local/bin such as
neutron-keepalived-state-change and neutron-ns-metadata-proxy.
In stead of adding individual filters to allow them to run from that
directory, this patch adds /usr/local/bin into exec_dirs.

Please also refer to I3abd1c173121dc8abb5738d1879db8ac9a98b690 for
discussion on the approach to fix the bug.

Change-Id: Iade8b5b09bb53018485c85f8372fb94dbc2ad2da
Closes-Bug: 1435971

commit_message:
Revised cluster-update implementation

We now allow min_size and max_size to be updated. So, the code must
be generic and flexible to support different combinations of update
parameters. This patch revised the cluster-update api implementation
which will be followed by a revision at cluster-action level.

Change-Id: I3718c1ead517ad719a34d83ffc0c4a4c6a49b5fb

commit_message:
Add min_size and max_size properties to Cluster

Two new properties are added to cluster: min_size and max_size.
This patch provides related support from client side. Now user
can specify the min and max size of cluster when creating it.

Change-Id: I72869259993ec8a8697eba45c12bf6ba9d408292
Implements: blueprint add-size-limitation-properties-to-cluster

subject: Nic bonding support for SRIOV ports
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-29 14:22:35.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/approved/libvirt-sriov-nic-bonding.rst'], 'message': "Nic bonding support for SRIOV ports

We want to enchance Nova to be able to bond SR-IOV ports to provide HA.
First of all we need to create a mechanism which can land VFs to the different
PFs if it's needed. Next step will be create a Neutron call to hold number of
VFs we need for it.

Change-Id: I7e790b2dc33a170008283ff6bc2e6e17b09bbddb
"}]
commit_message:
Nic bonding support for SRIOV ports

We want to enchance Nova to be able to bond SR-IOV ports to provide HA.
First of all we need to create a mechanism which can land VFs to the different
PFs if it's needed. Next step will be create a Neutron call to hold number of
VFs we need for it.

Change-Id: I7e790b2dc33a170008283ff6bc2e6e17b09bbddb

commit_message:
Add a new libvirt volume driver for Huawei SDSHypervisor

Add a new volume driver in nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py file to realize
attach/detach volume to qemu-kvm instance, and realize abstract volume dirver
methods:
* connect_volume
* disconnect_volume

The user CRUD section had several issues.

 - The pipelines are now defined in keystone-paste.ini

commit_message:
Fix issues in User CRUD section

The user CRUD section had several issues.

 - CRUD wasn't defined
 - public_api is a literal string from the config file
 - The pipelines are now defined in keystone-paste.ini
 - The default pipeline has changed, stats_monitoring and xml_body
   don't exist anymore
 - tokens are invalidated in every token persistence backend

These are corrected.

Change-Id: I0620e8543d76220e2263ace2145e2b4eb0529b30

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-29 23:27:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/local_dev/lvm.py'], 'message': "Add retry to lvm delete

Seems we have another issue related to lvm and
snapshots, but this time it's on the delete side.

We used a simple retry mechanism for snapshot create
here:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/149360/8

I'm hesitant to just add another retry without looking
at dm issues, but this should address the problem
temporarily and give us a chance to collect some
data on the issue.

Change-Id: I37607a09e2f9af6f2f32ddfaa8567400541e533a
Closes-Bug: #1450110
"}]
commit_message:
Add retry to lvm delete

Seems we have another issue related to lvm and
snapshots, but this time it's on the delete side.

We used a simple retry mechanism for snapshot create
here:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/149360/8

I'm hesitant to just add another retry without looking
at dm issues, but this should address the problem
temporarily and give us a chance to collect some
data on the issue.

Change-Id: I37607a09e2f9af6f2f32ddfaa8567400541e533a
Closes-Bug: #1450110

subject: Mount with -o nouuid for XFS base images
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-24 03:43:16.000000000', 'files': ['elements/redhat-common/bin/extract-image'], 'message': 'Mount with -o nouuid for XFS base images

This change uses blkid to identify the fs type during redhat-common
extract-image. The image is mounted with -o nouuid for redhat/rhel
images that have XFS filesystems.

This is required when building images from the same base image
as the host VM to avoid "Filesystem has duplicate UUID" mount
failures.

Change-Id: I066289fbb27733a5a555242a0e2c363d58dd27d0
Closes-Bug: 1443706
'}]
commit_message:
Mount with -o nouuid for XFS base images

This change uses blkid to identify the fs type during redhat-common
extract-image. The image is mounted with -o nouuid for redhat/rhel
images that have XFS filesystems.

This is required when building images from the same base image
as the host VM to avoid "Filesystem has duplicate UUID" mount
failures.

Change-Id: I066289fbb27733a5a555242a0e2c363d58dd27d0
Closes-Bug: 1443706

commit_message:
Add min_adjustment_step property to ScalingPolicy

Adds `min_adjustment_step` property to ScalingPolicy
resource. It represents the minimum number of resources
that are added or removed when AutoScaling group scales
up or down. This can be used only when specifying value
`percent_change_in_capacity` for `adjustment_type` property.

Change-Id: Ia8976e52047ab47245566487ce1872a8890bcff2
Closes-Bug: #1447913

Change-Id: I780fffa1e8a830b598ac2cee963c79ccad154e6a

commit_message:
Drop tox from test-requirements.txt

test-reqs.xt gets installed by tox, so the chicken is before the egg.
This blocks devstack when run with strict requirements, as tox isn't
listed in global-requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I780fffa1e8a830b598ac2cee963c79ccad154e6a

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-01 21:38:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_xio.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/brick/test_brick_linuxscsi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/integrated/test_extensions.py'], 'message': "Fake out sleeps in unit tests

Just a minor cleanup, had a few tests that were doing sleeps
(or looping calls for those that prefer it) that were being
executed to test timeouts in the unit tests.  No value in
actually *waiting* for these, so this patch just mocks them
out so we still test the procedure but don't actually have
to wait.

This shaves about 30 seconds or so off of the unit test run,
not a huge deal, but every little bit helps IMO.

Also noticed a LOG.debug message in the test_extensions file
that wasn't picked up in other cleanup work so I removed that
debug log call as well.

Change-Id: I415ac75816e8a0f4c48c61b23391df1a9a016d62
"}]
commit_message:
Fake out sleeps in unit tests

Just a minor cleanup, had a few tests that were doing sleeps
(or looping calls for those that prefer it) that were being
executed to test timeouts in the unit tests.  No value in
actually *waiting* for these, so this patch just mocks them
out so we still test the procedure but don't actually have
to wait.

This shaves about 30 seconds or so off of the unit test run,
not a huge deal, but every little bit helps IMO.

Also noticed a LOG.debug message in the test_extensions file
that wasn't picked up in other cleanup work so I removed that
debug log call as well.

Change-Id: I415ac75816e8a0f4c48c61b23391df1a9a016d62

commit_message:
Specify Nova API versions clearly

Now Nova v2.1 API is CURRENT and v2 is SUPPORTED.
We have a plan to switch /v2 endpoint to v2.1 API on Nova side, and
we need to test both APIs on the gate.
This patch makes check-dg-tempest-dsvm-full v2 API specific clearly
and changes the configuration way based on the Depends-On patch.

Change-Id: I9ebcde2135d31f6ebefd1017cf8de3b07f497fca
Depends-On: Iba57eab5947c3e9112e8e6d12b8212e964a8d8ca

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 16:47:14.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py', 'cinder/openstack/common/scheduler/filters/extra_specs_ops.py', 'cinder/openstack/common/scheduler/filters/json_filter.py', 'cinder/openstack/common/periodic_task.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package.

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as

with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I950f1afb1b4600dfc1f38d1a7d9322f240f444a6

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package.

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I950f1afb1b4600dfc1f38d1a7d9322f240f444a6

commit_message:
Update vendor support to reflect v2 non-task

Vexxhost and RunAbove both support v2 of glance, but do not require
the task interface. Update the erroneous information. Also, there are
two additional regions for Rackspace that we did not list. We don't
list the Rackspace LON region because it does not work like the others
and we do not know how to support it.

Change-Id: Ib155d00d1d6bf7b2e5bcf4b868c268561e198611

commit_message:
Add hacking check for str and unicode in exceptions

One of the comments we are frequently having to make
on reviews is with regards to the use of str() or
unicode() on exceptions.  This hacking check pulled
from Nova will catch this problem earlier and avoid
conflicting comments being made in reviews.

Change-Id: I09eaf7b066f3e29733e6cbe16b2997edb6bc5e23

We don't need it for anything other than detecting whether or not we
should update the sources.list file. Except that's obviously not
something we should do on systems with yum

Remove the call and defer it to install_puppet where it's also
installed.

Change-Id: Ie22aeac1e4c731e7ab61514cb4982c8c35c482e6
"}]
commit_message:
Don't install redhat-lsb-core in prepare_node

We don't need it for anything other than detecting whether or not we
should update the sources.list file. Except that's obviously not
something we should do on systems with yum

Remove the call and defer it to install_puppet where it's also
installed.

Change-Id: Ie22aeac1e4c731e7ab61514cb4982c8c35c482e6

commit_message:
Override boot options via glance property

The current PXE boot kernel command line is global in nature.  Instead,
allow individual images to override the global kernel command line with
glance image properites.

Change-Id: Ia1add8a1b27a8e7aefca8c6fd186335fc8cea6a8

Storage server may be configured to protect target discovering phase with CHAP
authentication, in this case existing discovery command will be failed.
The authentication properties are:

Cinder Storage driver need to send discovery auth properties in this case,
and the properties are:

commit_message:
Failed to discovery when iscsi multipath and CHAP both enabled

Storage server may be configured to protect target discovering phase with CHAP
authentication, in this case existing discovery command will be failed.
The authentication properties are:
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.authmethod",
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.username",
    "discovery.sendtargets.auth.password"
Cinder Storage driver need to send discovery auth properties in this case,
and the properties are:
    iscsi_properties['discovery_auth_method']
    iscsi_properties['discovery_auth_username']
    iscsi_properties['discovery_auth_password']

(cherry picked from commit 45227bbbfd06d16e85e973e14ee8c30e267e8b42)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_volume.py

Closes-Bug: #1367189
Change-Id: Ic70426d7d0fd8126879840f05341731ed92d6392

subject: Type conflict in trusted_filter.py using attestation_port default value
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-23 15:02:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/scheduler/filters/test_trusted_filters.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/trusted_filter.py'], 'message': 'Type conflict in trusted_filter.py using attestation_port default value

When trusted filter (nova/nova/scheduler/filters/trusted_filter.py)
in nova scheduler is running with default value of attestation_port:

default='8443'

method _do_request() in AttestationService class has this line:

action_url = "https://%s:%d%s/%s" % (self.host,
self.port, self.api_url, action_url)

It is easy to see that default type of attestation_port is string.
But in action_url self.port is required as integer (%d).
It leads to conflict.

This change provides more tests than is required only to cover this bug
fix. This cases are testing AttestationService _do_request() method
using different status_codes and different texts returned by mocked
request method.

(cherry picked from commit fdcf358eaeef6edb5c8d2dcc94f906a22882544a)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_trusted_filters.py

Tests aren't in tests/unit/.

Use jsonutils from nova.openstack.common instead of oslo.utils.

Closes-Bug: #1381468
Change-Id: I1ad57b5bd1986360416948fd00dec22456dc29a7
'}]
commit_message:
Type conflict in trusted_filter.py using attestation_port default value

When trusted filter (nova/nova/scheduler/filters/trusted_filter.py)
in nova scheduler is running with default value of attestation_port:

default='8443'

method _do_request() in AttestationService class has this line:

action_url = "https://%s:%d%s/%s" % (self.host,
self.port, self.api_url, action_url)

It is easy to see that default type of attestation_port is string.
But in action_url self.port is required as integer (%d).
It leads to conflict.

This change provides more tests than is required only to cover this bug
fix. This cases are testing AttestationService _do_request() method
using different status_codes and different texts returned by mocked
request method.

(cherry picked from commit fdcf358eaeef6edb5c8d2dcc94f906a22882544a)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_trusted_filters.py

Tests aren't in tests/unit/.

Use jsonutils from nova.openstack.common instead of oslo.utils.

Closes-Bug: #1381468
Change-Id: I1ad57b5bd1986360416948fd00dec22456dc29a7

commit_message:
Moves trusted filter unit tests into own file

Breaks out trusted filter unit tests into their own file. In the
process, we remove all DB accesses from the unit tests and uncruft the
unit tests with mock.

(cherry picked from commit f388ac5e8f5338fd2c4817de11b7436f85036bc6)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/scheduler/test_host_filters.py

Backporting this patch for
change I1ad57b5bd1986360416948fd00dec22456dc29a7 .

Added nova/tests/scheduler/filters/__init__.py, which is created by a
patch we aren't pulling in.

Updated test to use timeutils from nova.openstack.common instead of
oslo.utils, as the filter hasn't been updated yet to use oslo.utils.

Change-Id: Ic895b06a9f6a224f153f12ca5ab54dc8be931f13

commit_message:
Hyper-V: Sets *DataRoot paths for instances

Sets the path for the instance's ConfigurationDataRoot,
LogDataRoot, SnapshotDataRoot, SuspendDataRoot and
SwapFileDataRoot for vmutilsv2 instances and
ExternalDataRoot and SnapshotDataRoot for vmutils
to the instance's location.

Closes-Bug: #1430239

(cherry picked from commit 3e42c7ae3f7a9353834c8c9c4dc79ee39dd0783b)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_hypervapi.py
	nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmops.py
	nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmutils.py
	nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmutilsv2.py
	nova/virt/hyperv/vmops.py
	nova/virt/hyperv/vmutils.py
	nova/virt/hyperv/vmutilsv2.py

Change-Id: I3c9e2dece00df06cafdcd164ece6269337feda71

'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V dynamic memory issue with vNUMA

vNUMA and dynamic memory are mutually exclusive, so the former
needs to be disabled for instances where dynamic memory is enabled.

Change-Id: Ic730c294ffc89925076688a44adf2594c7f6712b
Closes-Bug: #1305897
(cherry picked from commit 1b20a40aa18c0f248256f2ae36e328b4a7cc20c1)

subject: Port Removal handling
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-05-03 11:36:26.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/l3_openflow_app.py'], 'message': "Port Removal handling

Only handles events generated from ovs itself. Future patches will
handle events generated from Neutron

Port removal is designed to be agnostic to the purpose of the flows.
It uses a Bloom Filter [1] to select the flows to be removed. We can
handle mismatches since if valid flow was removed it will be recreated
by the controller on next packet.This puts the responsibility of marking
the flow on the flow creator.
When creating a flow, it's important that the cookie contain a filter
built from all the ports that need to exist for the flow to remain
active.To create a proper filter one should use the provided
CookieFilter()
class. Specifically CookieFilter.from_route([port1, port2, ...]).The
values used are the values returned from PortData.cookie_hash.

[1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloom_filter

Change-Id: I10fd206b2ad8875ec7a2f9abdb9d13e74ea0cb77
"}]
commit_message:
Port Removal handling

Only handles events generated from ovs itself. Future patches will
handle events generated from Neutron

Port removal is designed to be agnostic to the purpose of the flows.
It uses a Bloom Filter [1] to select the flows to be removed. We can
handle mismatches since if valid flow was removed it will be recreated
by the controller on next packet.This puts the responsibility of marking
the flow on the flow creator.
When creating a flow, it's important that the cookie contain a filter
built from all the ports that need to exist for the flow to remain
active.To create a proper filter one should use the provided
CookieFilter()
class. Specifically CookieFilter.from_route([port1, port2, ...]).The
values used are the values returned from PortData.cookie_hash.

[1] http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bloom_filter

Change-Id: I10fd206b2ad8875ec7a2f9abdb9d13e74ea0cb77

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-03 07:45:42.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/propose_translation_update.sh'], 'message': "Fix translation steps

Today's nova import had some file changes where only the
POT-Creation-Date was changed which we don't need to import.

With the new compression step, we need to filter out commits *after* the
compression, otherwise counting is wrong.

Change-Id: Ib8fe6ca5f77c805147b73fe94905c72ccf3369d4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix translation steps

Today's nova import had some file changes where only the
POT-Creation-Date was changed which we don't need to import.

With the new compression step, we need to filter out commits *after* the
compression, otherwise counting is wrong.

Change-Id: Ib8fe6ca5f77c805147b73fe94905c72ccf3369d4

subject: Add task-upload command for uploading images in v2
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 6484, 'name': 'Feilong Wang', 'email': 'hustemb@gmail.com', 'username': 'flwang'}, {'_account_id': 9096, 'name': 'Cindy Pallares', 'email': 'u1@cindy.sh', 'username': 'cpallares'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-13 01:06:12.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'glanceclient/v2/shell.py', 'glanceclient/common/auth.py'], 'message': 'Add task-upload command for uploading images in v2

There are several complicated steps involved with uploading an image
successfully in the glance v2 API. Provide an all-in-one command that
does these steps, with an optional "--poll" options modeled after the
nova --poll options which will poll the task status and ultimately print
the image dict.

This change adds python-swiftclient as a hard dependency, because even
if a user does not want to use the task-upload command, swiftclient _IS_
a hard dependency for anyone who wants to upload an image with v2.

Change-Id: Ifd2fb913284a56684a4ed3611f743e5ad0645137
'}]
commit_message:
Add task-upload command for uploading images in v2

There are several complicated steps involved with uploading an image
successfully in the glance v2 API. Provide an all-in-one command that
does these steps, with an optional "--poll" options modeled after the
nova --poll options which will poll the task status and ultimately print
the image dict.

This change adds python-swiftclient as a hard dependency, because even
if a user does not want to use the task-upload command, swiftclient _IS_
a hard dependency for anyone who wants to upload an image with v2.

Change-Id: Ifd2fb913284a56684a4ed3611f743e5ad0645137

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-04-29 22:50:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/linux/test_ovsdb_monitor.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/ovsdb_monitor.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_ovsdb_monitor.py'], 'message': 'Remove is_active property from SimpleInterfaceMonitor

is_active property from SimpleInterfaceMonitor shadows
the method is_active inherited from AsyncProcess.
The property checks that ovsdb monitor is running and
that it received some data. When ovsdb monitor starts
it always receives data, since it processes the interfaces
present on the machine, so the flag data_received will
always be set to true right after SimpleInterfaceMonitor
starts. Considering that, is_active can be removed and
the method is_active inherited from AsyncProcess can be
used instead.

Change-Id: I05faeddd061ab45af51c044a10462c3a57593d4d
'}]
commit_message:
Remove is_active property from SimpleInterfaceMonitor

is_active property from SimpleInterfaceMonitor shadows
the method is_active inherited from AsyncProcess.
The property checks that ovsdb monitor is running and
that it received some data. When ovsdb monitor starts
it always receives data, since it processes the interfaces
present on the machine, so the flag data_received will
always be set to true right after SimpleInterfaceMonitor
starts. Considering that, is_active can be removed and
the method is_active inherited from AsyncProcess can be
used instead.

Change-Id: I05faeddd061ab45af51c044a10462c3a57593d4d

The API-based Kilo plugin is not configured to run unit tests properly,
which caused the following issues:

 * A bug in lbaas API
 * DHCP extra options not implemented

Change-Id: I479372e4f2c46dc0c4285a485c38829643c08ec7
Fixes: MNP-117

commit_message:
Configure API-based plugin unit tests

The API-based Kilo plugin is not configured to run unit tests properly,
which caused the following issues:

 * A bug in lbaas API
 * DHCP extra options not implemented

Change-Id: I479372e4f2c46dc0c4285a485c38829643c08ec7
Fixes: MNP-117

subject: Make vmtasks network_wrapper code less wonky
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-01 17:11:31.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/scenarios/vm/utils.py', 'tests/unit/benchmark/scenarios/vm/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'Make vmtasks network_wrapper code less wonky

The VM utils module used some wonky code to get a persistent network
wrapper object, which is not necessary and reduces code
readability. This removes said code.

Change-Id: Ifb336ecb4c65a7eab0294fa13fae793ac72fb9de

commit_message:
Make vmtasks network_wrapper code less wonky

The VM utils module used some wonky code to get a persistent network
wrapper object, which is not necessary and reduces code
readability. This removes said code.

Change-Id: Ifb336ecb4c65a7eab0294fa13fae793ac72fb9de

subject: Add tempest-dsvm-sahara
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-05-01 22:16:55.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/sahara.yaml'], 'message': 'Add tempest-dsvm-sahara

Because sahara builds on the compute base layer, it does not need to be
tested in all devstack-gate jobs. Instead create a new job that tests
sahara in a devstack environment as a first step in removing it from the
standard configuration.

Specify that SAHARA should be enabled in the devstack updown job
so that the parts that enable sahara are exercised in devstack.
This is already currently the case, but this updates the job config
so that it will continue to do so later when we remove sahara from
the default config.

Change-Id: Iae4e2439bfdfe7f3fc5f0b75b38583a70d7d78f4
Co-Authored-By: James E. Blair <jeblair@hp.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add tempest-dsvm-sahara

Because sahara builds on the compute base layer, it does not need to be
tested in all devstack-gate jobs. Instead create a new job that tests
sahara in a devstack environment as a first step in removing it from the
standard configuration.

Specify that SAHARA should be enabled in the devstack updown job
so that the parts that enable sahara are exercised in devstack.
This is already currently the case, but this updates the job config
so that it will continue to do so later when we remove sahara from
the default config.

Change-Id: Iae4e2439bfdfe7f3fc5f0b75b38583a70d7d78f4
Co-Authored-By: James E. Blair <jeblair@hp.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-03 01:48:39.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py'], 'message': 'Get all interfaces for get_snat_sync_interfaces

The get_snat_sync_interfaces method was being called for
each router individually during a sync, which resulted
in a new query to the database.

This patch eliminates that waste by querying for the snat
interfaces for all of the routers in the list at once.

Change-Id: I1e44a0cf15a70632e8b62ac89ce807a7a457747d
Partial-Bug: #1445412
'}]
commit_message:
Get all interfaces for get_snat_sync_interfaces

The get_snat_sync_interfaces method was being called for
each router individually during a sync, which resulted
in a new query to the database.

This patch eliminates that waste by querying for the snat
interfaces for all of the routers in the list at once.

Change-Id: I1e44a0cf15a70632e8b62ac89ce807a7a457747d
Partial-Bug: #1445412

commit_message:
Replace exec calls with cryptography library

Many places where the openssl command line is executed can be
replaced with the newer cryptography library that provides
openssl bindings.

Change-Id: Id18fe9f8488204e73d063d7771357eced82e441f

Closes-Bug: #1421492

commit_message:
Admin extends tenant's volume but change admin's quota

When admin extends a tenant's volume, the tenant's
quota-usage doesn't change. However, admin's quota-usage
has changed. The right practice is: extend whose volume,
whose quota-usage should be changed.

Change-Id: Ia1bed7f212cbee715e29698ebbfe3c67486a55f5
Closes-Bug: #1421492

subject: Fix exception re-raise during task execution for py34
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6133, 'name': 'yolanda.robla', 'email': 'yroblamo@redhat.com', 'username': 'yolanda.robla'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-05-02 15:49:47.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_task_manager.py', 'shade/task_manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix exception re-raise during task execution for py34

This is the code fragment from six (executed when the interpreter is
python 3):

    def reraise(tp, value, tb=None):
        if value is None:
            value = tp()
        if value.__traceback__ is not tb:
            raise value.with_traceback(tb)
        raise value

We want `raise value` or `raise value.with_traceback(tb)` to be
executed as we are invoking six.reraise with a class instance.

Change-Id: Ic0c7e14cecb1cbdcb8cae87047e20514c4d38301
'}]
commit_message:
Fix exception re-raise during task execution for py34

This is the code fragment from six (executed when the interpreter is
python 3):

    def reraise(tp, value, tb=None):
        if value is None:
            value = tp()
        if value.__traceback__ is not tb:
            raise value.with_traceback(tb)
        raise value

We want `raise value` or `raise value.with_traceback(tb)` to be
executed as we are invoking six.reraise with a class instance.

Change-Id: Ic0c7e14cecb1cbdcb8cae87047e20514c4d38301

subject: Add early service fail and active check method
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-05-01 09:02:35.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_shade.py', 'shade/__init__.py', 'shade/exc.py'], 'message': 'Add early service fail and active check method

To make things clearer - do an active check at each client instantiation
to make sure that the service exists in the catalog so that we can throw
a clear error. Also, add a method that can be used for switching on
things like "if neutron: neutron-floating-ips: else: nova-floating-ips"
that doesn't have to do a REST roundtrip to find the failure.

Change-Id: I43b32fff56e09f31bd6d6845b3bf9b5414632651
'}]
commit_message:
Add early service fail and active check method

To make things clearer - do an active check at each client instantiation
to make sure that the service exists in the catalog so that we can throw
a clear error. Also, add a method that can be used for switching on
things like "if neutron: neutron-floating-ips: else: nova-floating-ips"
that doesn't have to do a REST roundtrip to find the failure.

Change-Id: I43b32fff56e09f31bd6d6845b3bf9b5414632651

subject: Replace subprocess with run_local in _find_images
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-02 12:18:22.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/elements/cache-devstack/extra-data.d/55-cache-devstack-repos', 'nodepool/scripts/cache_devstack.py'], 'message': "Replace subprocess with run_local in _find_images

In the DevStack caching script/element for Nodepool images, use
run_local instead of subprocess.check_output in the _find_images
function. The latter wasn't introduced until Python 2.7 and so won't
work on CentOS 6. The script called from this function returns
quickly and doesn't benefit from non-blocking I/O anyway.

Change-Id: I3129f1f5b3fece321ae132ea1a52b0e156e58365
"}]
commit_message:
Replace subprocess with run_local in _find_images

In the DevStack caching script/element for Nodepool images, use
run_local instead of subprocess.check_output in the _find_images
function. The latter wasn't introduced until Python 2.7 and so won't
work on CentOS 6. The script called from this function returns
quickly and doesn't benefit from non-blocking I/O anyway.

Change-Id: I3129f1f5b3fece321ae132ea1a52b0e156e58365

commit_message:
Add /usr/local/bin to exec_dirs in rootwrap.conf

devstack installs some utilities into /usr/local/bin such as
ebrctl. This patch adds /usr/local/bin into exec_dirs to allow
rootwrap  to search executables in this directory.

Closes-Bug: #1451018

Change-Id: I7423c3ba1bd12dc696543fc8c2275047e61a8879

[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-05-01 09:02:35.000000000', 'files': ['shade/meta.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': "Raise a shade exception on broken volumes

Some clouds don't have volumes and bomb out here, which is a bad place
to bomb out. A later patch will add an active check for service
existence, but we still should catch and throw here so that we're not
leaking python-*client exceptions.

Change-Id: I1f768dcd6ad6f54fb1b5638e9486653ee07965ef

commit_message:
Raise a shade exception on broken volumes

Some clouds don't have volumes and bomb out here, which is a bad place
to bomb out. A later patch will add an active check for service
existence, but we still should catch and throw here so that we're not
leaking python-*client exceptions.

Change-Id: I1f768dcd6ad6f54fb1b5638e9486653ee07965ef

commit_message:
Split exceptions into their own file

We were getting to the point where we were making some circular depends.
Clear that up by splitting the exceptions into their own file.

We're importing * to keep the external interface in the ansible modules.

Change-Id: I1d804377c3cd4eebcc94624902f9e5ec6ebf9321

subject: Add thread sync points to Task
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-01 13:42:35.000000000', 'files': ['shade/task_manager.py'], 'message': "Add thread sync points to Task

Although the default behavior of Task is to return immediately in shade,
the reason it's abstracted at all is to facilitate multi-threaded
rate-limited TaskManagers such as the one found in nodepool. In order
for those to work, we kind of need the wait conditions to actual do
something.

Change-Id: Icce9729aa2f8f31931dd9d3723d9d5d758436fa9
"}]
commit_message:
Add thread sync points to Task

Although the default behavior of Task is to return immediately in shade,
the reason it's abstracted at all is to facilitate multi-threaded
rate-limited TaskManagers such as the one found in nodepool. In order
for those to work, we kind of need the wait conditions to actual do
something.

Change-Id: Icce9729aa2f8f31931dd9d3723d9d5d758436fa9

subject: Handle empty translation files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-02 07:11:56.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/propose_translation_update.sh'], 'message': 'Handle empty translation files

We have some strange files in the tree that contain no or little
translation after merging - and these are downloaded from transifex.
So, these files are not known to git and git rm fails.
To not special case every git rm and git reset for both old and new
files, re-add a "git add" at the beginning so that we can operate on
files known to git.

Note: This happens when we have a file like glance-log-critical.po that has no
strings - but we had to create it with initial content in transifex,
since empty files are not allowed there.

Change-Id: Ie9bb3e59560d50829e56928b2ed79e3999dd39cb
'}]
commit_message:
Handle empty translation files

We have some strange files in the tree that contain no or little
translation after merging - and these are downloaded from transifex.
So, these files are not known to git and git rm fails.
To not special case every git rm and git reset for both old and new
files, re-add a "git add" at the beginning so that we can operate on
files known to git.

Note: This happens when we have a file like glance-log-critical.po that has no
strings - but we had to create it with initial content in transifex,
since empty files are not allowed there.

Change-Id: Ie9bb3e59560d50829e56928b2ed79e3999dd39cb

commit_message:
Create a unit test for wordpress specification in TOSCA

Create a TOSCA-HOT translation unit test template and use that to
unit test TOSCA wordpress example.

Note, to implement this patch some changes had to be made to the
wordpress TOSCA file as translation of certain pieces were not fully
supported, as described in bug #1440247. As a result of the change in
wordpress TOSCA file some existing test cases had to be skipped as
well. It is important to re-enable the skipped code and revert the
changes made to wordpress TOSCA file as part of bug #1440247 patch.

Also, shell scripts that support mysql, web server, and wordpress
installation and configuration were also updated to make sure the
HOT translation works with the ubuntu-software-config-os-init image.

To address bug #1447800 handling of null dictionaries was also
improved.

Change-Id: I2710eabb0a74c4d75498ac2d0fe3e50ea50133ab
Closes-Bug: #1435545
Closes-Bug: #1447800
Partial-Bug: #1436420
Related-Bug: #1440247

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 7806, 'name': 'Sushil Kumar', 'email': 'skm.net@gmail.com', 'username': 'sushilkm'}, {'_account_id': 9664, 'name': 'amrith', 'email': 'amrith.kumar@gmail.com', 'username': 'amrith'}, {'_account_id': 9782, 'name': 'Morgan Jones', 'email': 'morgan@tesora.com', 'username': 'vgnbkr'}, {'_account_id': 10215, 'name': 'Peter Stachowski', 'email': 'peter@tesora.com', 'username': 'peterstac'}, {'_account_id': 10295, 'name': 'mariam john', 'email': 'mariamj@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'mariamj'}, {'_account_id': 14576, 'name': 'Petr Malik', 'email': 'pmalik@tesora.com', 'username': 'pmalik'}, {'_account_id': 14829, 'name': 'Ashleigh Farnham', 'username': 'ashleighfarnham', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 15090, 'name': 'Elvis Teixeira', 'email': 'elvis.teixeira@lsbd.ufc.br', 'username': 'ElvisTeixeira'}, {'_account_id': 15321, 'name': 'Matthew Van Dijk', 'email': 'mvandijk@tesora.com', 'username': 'mvandijk'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2015-05-01 04:09:36.000000000', 'files': ['trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/db2/system.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/mysql/service.py', 'trove/guestagent/common/operating_system.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/couchbase/service.py', 'trove/guestagent/strategies/restore/mysql_impl.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/cassandra/service.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_operating_system.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_volume.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/mongodb/manager.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/service/config.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_redis_manager.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/couchdb/service.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/guestagent/test_dbaas.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/redis/manager.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/db2/service.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/redis/service.py', 'trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/cassandra/system.py', 'trove/guestagent/volume.py'], 'message': 'Abstract 'mkdir' shell commands in guestagent

The guestagent commonly executes basic shell commands
such as 'mkdir' across multiple files and datastores.
Each datastore currently scripts its own shell calls.
Apart from cluttering the Python code with shell constructs,
it also makes maintenance of the shell calls more difficult by
requiring the same change be made across multiple lines,
source files and/or potentially even datastores.

The goal of this patch set is to provide a simple straightforward
interface for most common shell calls used across the guestagent
code while encapsulating the related shell code into a single module.

This patch set includes refactoring of 'mkdir' and related 'chown'
calls.
It also introduces unit tests ('guestagent/test_operating_system')
for the above implementations.

The shell code was moved into 'common/operating_system' module.
The replacing interface is:

def create_directory(dir_path, user=None, group=None, force=True):
    """Create a given directory and update its ownership
    (recursively) to the given user and group if any."""

The existing interface for 'chown' has been extended to maintain
consistency with 'mkdir'.

def chown(path, user, group, recursive=True, force=False):
    """Changes the owner and group of a given file.
    """

The calls also take optional keyword arguments:
    :param as_root:          Execute as root.
    :type as_root:           boolean

    :param timeout:          Number of seconds if specified,
                             default if not.
                             There is no timeout if set to None.
    :type timeout:           integer

Most occurrences of the above two shell calls ('mkdir' and 'chown')
in the guestagent code have been replaced by the above abstraction.
I did not replace native Python os.chown() and os.mkdir() calls
and calls that are executed as a part of a larger shell script
in this patch set.

Authored-By: Petr Malik <pmalik@tesora.com>
Change-Id: I0fe96301087e3bd49d937c7c489006fd9d84ca1e
Depends-On: Ib969a111d102b817c9f18437c1f36bd17e3a8a4b
Closes-Bug: 1431618
Related-Bug: 1438430
'}]
commit_message:
Abstract 'mkdir' shell commands in guestagent

The guestagent commonly executes basic shell commands
such as 'mkdir' across multiple files and datastores.
Each datastore currently scripts its own shell calls.
Apart from cluttering the Python code with shell constructs,
it also makes maintenance of the shell calls more difficult by
requiring the same change be made across multiple lines,
source files and/or potentially even datastores.

The goal of this patch set is to provide a simple straightforward
interface for most common shell calls used across the guestagent
code while encapsulating the related shell code into a single module.

This patch set includes refactoring of 'mkdir' and related 'chown'
calls.
It also introduces unit tests ('guestagent/test_operating_system')
for the above implementations.

The shell code was moved into 'common/operating_system' module.
The replacing interface is:

def create_directory(dir_path, user=None, group=None, force=True):
    """Create a given directory and update its ownership
    (recursively) to the given user and group if any."""

The existing interface for 'chown' has been extended to maintain
consistency with 'mkdir'.

def chown(path, user, group, recursive=True, force=False):
    """Changes the owner and group of a given file.
    """

The calls also take optional keyword arguments:
    :param as_root:          Execute as root.
    :type as_root:           boolean

    :param timeout:          Number of seconds if specified,
                             default if not.
                             There is no timeout if set to None.
    :type timeout:           integer

Most occurrences of the above two shell calls ('mkdir' and 'chown')
in the guestagent code have been replaced by the above abstraction.
I did not replace native Python os.chown() and os.mkdir() calls
and calls that are executed as a part of a larger shell script
in this patch set.

Authored-By: Petr Malik <pmalik@tesora.com>
Change-Id: I0fe96301087e3bd49d937c7c489006fd9d84ca1e
Depends-On: Ib969a111d102b817c9f18437c1f36bd17e3a8a4b
Closes-Bug: 1431618
Related-Bug: 1438430

subject: Don't return default for domain in v2 accessinfo
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-01 22:10:11.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth/access.py'], 'message': "Don't return default for domain in v2 accessinfo

The V2 AccessInfo returns 'default' and 'Default' for domain_id and
domain_name parameters respectively because this information is not
included in the V2 token and it was trying to help.

Unfortunately this makes it impossible to tell if there is no domain
information available or the domain information is actually default
which may not be the case on all systems.

Make it so V2AccessInfo returns None for domain properties.

Change-Id: Ieb79c70ebe8e73b7f1a445015a3eb00bda322e8a
"}]
commit_message:
Don't return default for domain in v2 accessinfo

The V2 AccessInfo returns 'default' and 'Default' for domain_id and
domain_name parameters respectively because this information is not
included in the V2 token and it was trying to help.

Unfortunately this makes it impossible to tell if there is no domain
information available or the domain information is actually default
which may not be the case on all systems.

Make it so V2AccessInfo returns None for domain properties.

Change-Id: Ieb79c70ebe8e73b7f1a445015a3eb00bda322e8a

commit_message:
Libvirt: Correct logging information and progress when LM

Libvirt driver gives wrong progress information when doing live migration,
this case is happened when info.memory_total == 0, logging information will
log out 0% remaining, which should be 100% remaining.
This also impacts instance.progress.

Closes-Bug: #1441000
Change-Id: I392dcd4e0a8ecb8b19ec93db4629d799be2d1a4b

commit_message:
Remove double queries in l3 DB get methods

Two frequently called functions were querying the routerport table
and the corresponding ports just to get the port ID. Then they were
calling get_ports again with those port IDs, resulting in two queries
to the port table when there should have only been one.

This eliminates the second call to get_ports since all of the necessary
data hase been retrieved from the port table.

Change-Id: I806e9c380b7de048fe084b2baf4b6f92ab0edf6b
Partial-Bug: #1445412
(cherry picked from commit 3310c3c3d4c05c0d13f32f08f978ba4813e2a39a)

commit_message:
Remove double queries in l3 DB get methods

Two frequently called functions were querying the routerport table
and the corresponding ports just to get the port ID. Then they were
calling get_ports again with those port IDs, resulting in two queries
to the port table when there should have only been one.

This eliminates the second call to get_ports since all of the necessary
data hase been retrieved from the port table.

Change-Id: I806e9c380b7de048fe084b2baf4b6f92ab0edf6b
Partial-Bug: #1445412
(cherry picked from commit 3310c3c3d4c05c0d13f32f08f978ba4813e2a39a)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-20 21:59:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': "Set loading strategy to joined for Routerport/Port

The RouterPort model has a relationship to the ports model which
is frequently relied on to get the port IDs of interfaces attached
to a router. However, this defaults to the loading strategy to
'select', which meant a new query was being emitted for every
interface to the ports table just to get the ID.

This patch adjusts the relationship to be 'joined' by default so
one query will fetch the related ports.

Another option would have been not to use the port object at all since
the ID is all that the callers were usually interested in. However,
they would end up using the ID to do a port lookup, which is being
optimized away in another patch anyway so the full port object from
the relationship will end up getting used.

Change-Id: Id1ae35f845f7367d5f1f065c6fa637da7b980a2b
Partial-Bug: #1445412
(cherry picked from commit 10b17a884452736a6b214bcb7705b955192a1748)
"}]
commit_message:
Set loading strategy to joined for Routerport/Port

The RouterPort model has a relationship to the ports model which
is frequently relied on to get the port IDs of interfaces attached
to a router. However, this defaults to the loading strategy to
'select', which meant a new query was being emitted for every
interface to the ports table just to get the ID.

This patch adjusts the relationship to be 'joined' by default so
one query will fetch the related ports.

Another option would have been not to use the port object at all since
the ID is all that the callers were usually interested in. However,
they would end up using the ID to do a port lookup, which is being
optimized away in another patch anyway so the full port object from
the relationship will end up getting used.

Change-Id: Id1ae35f845f7367d5f1f065c6fa637da7b980a2b
Partial-Bug: #1445412
(cherry picked from commit 10b17a884452736a6b214bcb7705b955192a1748)

commit_message:
Set loading strategy to joined for Routerport/Port

The RouterPort model has a relationship to the ports model which
is frequently relied on to get the port IDs of interfaces attached
to a router. However, this defaults to the loading strategy to
'select', which meant a new query was being emitted for every
interface to the ports table just to get the ID.

This patch adjusts the relationship to be 'joined' by default so
one query will fetch the related ports.

Another option would have been not to use the port object at all since
the ID is all that the callers were usually interested in. However,
they would end up using the ID to do a port lookup, which is being
optimized away in another patch anyway so the full port object from
the relationship will end up getting used.

Change-Id: Id1ae35f845f7367d5f1f065c6fa637da7b980a2b
Partial-Bug: #1445412

This patches remove the hard-code permission checks for db call
fixed_ip_get_all and fixed_ip_get_all_by_host.

There are elevated contexts in the code used to call those calls
aren't removed in this patch. The elevated context will be cleaned up
in last step. This is safe if we forget removing some hard-code

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

Change-Id: Ia1ad362e72d094c4ed755a46dec003d9c0d3725d
"}]
commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for fixed_ip_get_*

This patches remove the hard-code permission checks for db call
fixed_ip_get_all and fixed_ip_get_all_by_host.

There are elevated contexts in the code used to call those calls
aren't removed in this patch. The elevated context will be cleaned up
in last step. This is safe if we forget removing some hard-code
permission.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

Change-Id: Ia1ad362e72d094c4ed755a46dec003d9c0d3725d

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: If8a132de65ba1e57ea93f98daac66816a3cefaa8

commit_message:
Finally let L3 and DHCP agents cleanup namespaces by default

There has been a problem with iproute package that resulted in errors
when deleting the namespaces, so deleting was turned off by default.
According to tests with iproute version 3.12.0 there is no such issue
so the option could be safely turned on by default.

DocImpact
Related-Bug: #1052535
Related-Bug: #1402739

Change-Id: I4c831f98fb2462382ef0f9216e265555186b965a

commit_message:
Adds force docker service start

Despite being started via upstart in rare cases docker service
wasn't available on VM first boot. This commit adds force
server star step

commit_message:
Adds ability to delete docker applications from the host

Application deletion were supported on DSH/Pod but not exposed
in DockerApplication. Once it became exposed number of bugs in
KubernetesPod and DSH became visible.

Change-Id: I33650936a73994668f72348a909b7a51bae2b98c
Closes-Bug: #1446582

subject: Execute pre/post deployment hooks on GC
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-29 18:05:15.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/executor.py', 'murano/common/engine.py'], 'message': 'Execute pre/post deployment hooks on GC

Currently pre/post deployment are invoked only for
deployment (actions). Those hooks are used to stop
AgentListener. But they were not executed for GC
phase that could also start AgentListener.  As a result
we could get 2 AgentListeners running and stealing
messages from each other

Change-Id: If96db92e38f067bfed72cfc4a3d5619de2f0fad3
Closes-Bug: #1449500
'}]
commit_message:
Execute pre/post deployment hooks on GC

Currently pre/post deployment are invoked only for
deployment (actions). Those hooks are used to stop
AgentListener. But they were not executed for GC
phase that could also start AgentListener.  As a result
we could get 2 AgentListeners running and stealing
messages from each other

Change-Id: If96db92e38f067bfed72cfc4a3d5619de2f0fad3
Closes-Bug: #1449500

subject: pselect exited on first exception
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-30 12:22:14.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/helpers.py'], 'message': 'pselect exited on first exception

Due to eventlet bug in GreenPool implementation when first
spawned thread threw exception imap method exited immediately
without waiting for other spawned threads to accomplish.

Issue in eventlet github:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/232

This commits wraps executed functions so that no exception can be
raised on imap boundary and then unwraps result after execution

 Closes-Bug: #1449497

Change-Id: I0e99de8e0711071c4a009e37a58ec22761e90e6c
'}]
commit_message:
pselect exited on first exception

Due to eventlet bug in GreenPool implementation when first
spawned thread threw exception imap method exited immediately
without waiting for other spawned threads to accomplish.

Issue in eventlet github:
https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/232

This commits wraps executed functions so that no exception can be
raised on imap boundary and then unwraps result after execution

 Closes-Bug: #1449497

Change-Id: I0e99de8e0711071c4a009e37a58ec22761e90e6c

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-29 23:02:20.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py'], 'message': "Don't update port with host id of None

In the L3 RPC code if the host for a port is not
present, it ends up calling update_port with the
host_id set to None. This does not update the host
id at all because it's treated as an unset attribute
which leads to the same thing happening on the next
iteration. These pointless update calls are expensive
because they involve a semaphore and calls to mechanism
drivers.

This patch adjusts the logic to only send a port
update if it actually has a host to ensure is on
the port.

Change-Id: Ic55496dd2ba3abcef0a2de9fc8699c391b79fa51
Partial-Bug: #1445412
"}]
commit_message:
Don't update port with host id of None

In the L3 RPC code if the host for a port is not
present, it ends up calling update_port with the
host_id set to None. This does not update the host
id at all because it's treated as an unset attribute
which leads to the same thing happening on the next
iteration. These pointless update calls are expensive
because they involve a semaphore and calls to mechanism
drivers.

This patch adjusts the logic to only send a port
update if it actually has a host to ensure is on
the port.

Change-Id: Ic55496dd2ba3abcef0a2de9fc8699c391b79fa51
Partial-Bug: #1445412

commit_message:
Provide Fedora support for StrongSwan

The initial release of StrongSwan VPNaaS driver only support Ubuntu.
This patch will provide the Fedora support. The different usage of
StrongSwan between Fedora and Ubuntu are:
- Uses 'strongswan' CLI command instead of 'ipsec'
- Configuration files location is different
- Strongswan.d directory in template directory does not include
  'charon' directory

Change-Id: I27d8518d1d8110453d4674a0c6fb3cb6072a32f0
Closes-bug: 1444776
Closes-bug: 1441788

subject: Add image show tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-01 16:13:05.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/tests/image/v2/test_image.py', 'openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_server.py', 'openstackclient/tests/image/v2/fakes.py', 'openstackclient/tests/image/v1/test_image.py'], 'message': 'Add image show tests

Image v2 uses warlock objects rather than the usua Resource objects
so we need to test for those.  This adds a subset of the Image v2

Depends-On: Ic95db2f63d9f5f37e29f0d7e048397da311fbf8c

commit_message:
Add image show tests

Image v2 uses warlock objects rather than the usua Resource objects
so we need to test for those.  This adds a subset of the Image v2
schema that should be enough to test for proper warlock image handling.

Depends-On: Ic95db2f63d9f5f37e29f0d7e048397da311fbf8c
Change-Id: Ib89cce87f110a554f40e726718e31d39b500a6ae

commit_message:
Drop auth and corresponding unit tests

auth has been migrated to tempest-lib.
Fix all auth imports to use tempest-lib. Drop auth and related
unit tests.
Use token client from tempest-lib as well.

Depends-on: Ie6435b4f3a367b0a8cec68f21c0b4f5f61d6b688
Change-Id: I8c2772d9fb42d352f4a1d3e74e20ce6e8f483559

subject: Added SSL parameter for nova to talk with secured glance
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-07 00:36:35.000000000', 'files': ['lib/nova'], 'message': 'Added SSL parameter for nova to talk with secured glance

After https://review.openstack.org/#/c/72974 nova (somehow?)
uses ssl/cert_file to connect to glance. Analysis of such
behavior reasons is out of scope of this CR.

This change fixes configuration parameters according to
current nova behavior.

Change-Id: Ib78878af37484f3e176c9b5d27d188aa35a79924
Closes-Bug: #1405484'}]
commit_message:
Added SSL parameter for nova to talk with secured glance

After https://review.openstack.org/#/c/72974 nova (somehow?)
uses ssl/cert_file to connect to glance. Analysis of such
behavior reasons is out of scope of this CR.

This change fixes configuration parameters according to
current nova behavior.

Change-Id: Ib78878af37484f3e176c9b5d27d188aa35a79924
Closes-Bug: #1405484

subject: AccessInfo is not a dict
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-30 19:38:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth/access.py', 'keystoneauth/auth/identity/v2.py', 'keystoneauth/auth/identity/v3/base.py', 'keystoneauth/tests/unit/auth/test_identity_v3.py'], 'message': "AccessInfo is not a dict

Remove the dict subclass from AccessInfo and make it take a full token
object. This means that the object we are passed is a real token, and
not something that's been messed with.

We may need to add dict accessors back later but strip it out for now.

Change-Id: Ie9f134efeae91cfc8044fe97cfab066c84d07d50
"}]
commit_message:
AccessInfo is not a dict

Remove the dict subclass from AccessInfo and make it take a full token
object. This means that the object we are passed is a real token, and
not something that's been messed with.

We may need to add dict accessors back later but strip it out for now.

Change-Id: Ie9f134efeae91cfc8044fe97cfab066c84d07d50

subject: Make ServiceCatalog take an actual catalog
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-30 19:38:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth/access.py', 'keystoneauth/service_catalog.py'], 'message': 'Make ServiceCatalog take an actual catalog

The input for creating a service catalog should be a catalog dictionary,
not the AccessInfo object.

Add a helper function for loading a catalog from token data. This makes
the interaction unusual in AccessInfo but will help later.

Change-Id: Idf0ea38941b5270d4166db5661428c0ed2bd040e
'}]
commit_message:
Make ServiceCatalog take an actual catalog

The input for creating a service catalog should be a catalog dictionary,
not the AccessInfo object.

Add a helper function for loading a catalog from token data. This makes
the interaction unusual in AccessInfo but will help later.

Change-Id: Idf0ea38941b5270d4166db5661428c0ed2bd040e

subject: Provide lsb_release in snapshot builds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-01 17:32:28.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/prepare_node.sh'], 'message': "Provide lsb_release in snapshot builds

Some CentOS 6 images do not come with redhat-lsb-core preinstalled,
so the lsb_release command is not available when prepare_node.sh
wants it. Make sure we install it first if it's not already there.

Change-Id: Ieeae21538c237e069acbc4df051474071b81ba4a
"}]
commit_message:
Provide lsb_release in snapshot builds

Some CentOS 6 images do not come with redhat-lsb-core preinstalled,
so the lsb_release command is not available when prepare_node.sh
wants it. Make sure we install it first if it's not already there.

Change-Id: Ieeae21538c237e069acbc4df051474071b81ba4a

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-30 14:17:04.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-tempest.sh', 'rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/tempest_all.yml', 'rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/files/rpc_tempest_gate.sh', 'scripts/gate-check-commit.sh', 'rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/templates/tempest.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Update tempest and AIO to test cinder backups

This commit allows tempest to be configured to test the cinder backup
service.

Additionally, we:
- add a new function to openstack_tempest_gate.sh so we can include
  some cinder-backup-related API tests in our test list
- update bootstrap-aio.sh to enable cinder backups and the ability to
  test cinder backups
- update run-tempest.sh to include the cinder backup tests in the
  default test list

Change-Id: Iee7b40c9640aad6613b56a0f033da4294f3bfce7
Closes-Bug: #1449427
'}]
commit_message:
Update tempest and AIO to test cinder backups

This commit allows tempest to be configured to test the cinder backup
service.

Additionally, we:
- add a new function to openstack_tempest_gate.sh so we can include
  some cinder-backup-related API tests in our test list
- update bootstrap-aio.sh to enable cinder backups and the ability to
  test cinder backups
- update run-tempest.sh to include the cinder backup tests in the
  default test list

Change-Id: Iee7b40c9640aad6613b56a0f033da4294f3bfce7
Closes-Bug: #1449427

subject: Remove extra requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-29 23:36:07.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Remove extra requirements

Remove ipaddr and simpledispatch as they are dependencies pulled
in by WSME and pecan.

Since these requirements are not part of global-requirements a
build error will occur with devstack attempting to sync the requirements
that can be prevented by removing requirements that should be
pulled in by other packages.

Change-Id: Ib83afb4f11e478764f80a2fa8c0f47903ff999a2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove extra requirements

Remove ipaddr and simpledispatch as they are dependencies pulled
in by WSME and pecan.

Since these requirements are not part of global-requirements a
build error will occur with devstack attempting to sync the requirements
that can be prevented by removing requirements that should be
pulled in by other packages.

Change-Id: Ib83afb4f11e478764f80a2fa8c0f47903ff999a2

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Remove version

With the new release of pbr, we'll move networking-ovn to use
"postversioning". See email here [1] for details.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-April/063063.html

commit_message:
Add basic orchestration tests to the gate check

This change adds a "heat_api" test list that includes a few
basic orchestration api tests. To make it easier to build test
sets, the openstack_tempest_gate.sh script now accepts
multiple test lists as arguments, which are combined into a
single master list. The default test set for the gate check now
includes the "scenario" and "heat_api" lists.

Conflicts:
	rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/files/rpc_tempest_gate.sh
	scripts/run-tempest.sh

Change-Id: I51d5a7c47c3b5ff6a12f7ebccb0f40afa571c3d0
(cherry picked from commit 724ad211727b136d9f149fed75da4e5dc7206070)

commit_message:
devstack: Run ovn-controller with sudo.

ovn-controller needs root access to be able to manage the local
switch.  Without it we get errors like:

...|WARN|unix:/usr/local/var/run/openvswitch/br-int.mgmt:
connection failed (Permission denied)

Change-Id: I3d260f747ffe8adceed2dec3f0354c0870009a9f

For more info about these recommendations, see:

commit_message:
devstack: Update integration bridge config

Update configuration of the integration bridge with settings
recommended for OVN:

    fail-mode=secure other-config:disable-in-band=true

For more info about these recommendations, see:

    http://openvswitch.org/pipermail/dev/2015-April/054863.html

Change-Id: I2d07fbf57f48cb6de26ccff85693eb3d0b7107e5

commit_message:
Bump tempest-lib min version

The new version of tempest-lib was just pushed out. Tempest (and
likely other projects too) will start leveraging new functionality
added in this release, however before that can be done the min
version needs to be updated. For example, see tempest change:
I8c2772d9fb42d352f4a1d3e74e20ce6e8f483559 where the new version
is required.

Change-Id: Ie6435b4f3a367b0a8cec68f21c0b4f5f61d6b688

commit_message:
relax final pins

The following packages were pinned to a specific version, however they
are not the kind of software that should be pinned (they aren't
linters). Being non linters means we should either work with a range,
or we should remove them from being a dependency because they have
terrible compatibility stories.

Change-Id: I62f6ab9c34300482256b34456bb1b133d8fc45b3

subject: Default glance swift_backend to use local swift
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-30 16:38:36.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'etc/openstack_deploy/user_secrets.yml', 'etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_glance/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Default glance swift_backend to use local swift

The default values should use the local swift installation, since these
are only used when the glance backend is set to "swift" it won't matter
if there is no local swift when the backend is set to "file".

Adjust AIO script to use the defaults.

Move the configuration values from user_secrets.yml into
user_variables.yml since these are not passwords that should be set.
Additionally comment them out by default.

Change-Id: I579500a0287bc29f27fdbdb4f810212a2e194dea
Closes-Bug: #1450117
'}]
commit_message:
Default glance swift_backend to use local swift

The default values should use the local swift installation, since these
are only used when the glance backend is set to "swift" it won't matter
if there is no local swift when the backend is set to "file".

Adjust AIO script to use the defaults.

Move the configuration values from user_secrets.yml into
user_variables.yml since these are not passwords that should be set.
Additionally comment them out by default.

Change-Id: I579500a0287bc29f27fdbdb4f810212a2e194dea
Closes-Bug: #1450117

subject: Fix stevedore package conflict in devstack script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-29 21:35:54.000000000', 'files': ['thirdparty-requirements.txt', 'contrib/devstack/lib/congress'], 'message': 'Fix stevedore package conflict in devstack script

When installing python-muranoclient during devstack setup,
the dependent package stevedore is upgraded to 1.4.0 and it
conflicts with versions specified in global-requirements
causing heat failure. This change removes the "-U" from
"pip install" to skip installing a package if it exists
(as in the case of stevedore=1.3.0).

Closes-Bug: #1450010
Change-Id: Ia0fe33d66f7012391d54e28a804eb7540de323d4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix stevedore package conflict in devstack script

When installing python-muranoclient during devstack setup,
the dependent package stevedore is upgraded to 1.4.0 and it
conflicts with versions specified in global-requirements
causing heat failure. This change removes the "-U" from
"pip install" to skip installing a package if it exists
(as in the case of stevedore=1.3.0).

Closes-Bug: #1450010
Change-Id: Ia0fe33d66f7012391d54e28a804eb7540de323d4

subject: Lock down PBR to < version 0.11.0
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-05-01 15:53:22.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'playbooks/roles/repo_server/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Lock down PBR to < version 0.11.0

This change was made to ensure that PBR is using version < 0.11.0.
This is because changes in upstream PBR have made it impossible to
build contributing packages in heat and will likely impact other
services until the switch to liberty is in full effect. To ensure
consistent building of OpenStack packages PBR is now being installed
in the repo server containers which will ensure there are no
assumptions being made when creating python packages from OpenStack
contributing sources that may not be as well maintained as others.

Change-Id: I20c216543e63ef142119c2625fb219e030a708dd
Partial-bug: 1450733
'}]
commit_message:
Lock down PBR to < version 0.11.0

This change was made to ensure that PBR is using version < 0.11.0.
This is because changes in upstream PBR have made it impossible to
build contributing packages in heat and will likely impact other
services until the switch to liberty is in full effect. To ensure
consistent building of OpenStack packages PBR is now being installed
in the repo server containers which will ensure there are no
assumptions being made when creating python packages from OpenStack
contributing sources that may not be as well maintained as others.

Change-Id: I20c216543e63ef142119c2625fb219e030a708dd
Partial-bug: 1450733

commit_message:
Add logging when policies forbid an action

There is currently no logging in images.py of glance API v1 or v2
and other files of glance API when policies forbid an action.This
patch adds logging in these situations.

Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <ian.cordasco@rackspace.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kamil Rykowski <kamil.rykowski@intel.com>

Closes-Bug: #1270229
Change-Id: I32afbfc98a3de6370b0396f39c2cf481f6fc47a9

commit_message:
Updated cinder rootwrap for juno based on upstream

This change re-bases the cinder rootwrap volume filters based on
what is upstream. These changes should fix issues with cinder DD
that have been apparent in earlier versions of Juno.

Change-Id: I5a6af1b9d61e3bbb8e85c79ff55a91648a73e5e4
Closes-Bug: 1444602

subject: Don't save version into the dictionary
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-30 19:38:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth/access.py'], 'message': "Don't save version into the dictionary

By adding version to the dictionary you are getting further away from
the standard token object.

People do use this version property for figuring out what token version
it is so move it to a class property as it should never change anyway.

Change-Id: I3153b364248bf43d445ad2044f0c896efab6e573
"}]
commit_message:
Don't save version into the dictionary

By adding version to the dictionary you are getting further away from
the standard token object.

People do use this version property for figuring out what token version
it is so move it to a class property as it should never change anyway.

Change-Id: I3153b364248bf43d445ad2044f0c896efab6e573

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-04-22 10:02:09.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/neutron/security_groups_driver.py'], 'message': 'Hyperv agent does not respect remoteIpPrefix

Fixes Hyperv issue where Hyperv agent does not respect the remoteIp prefix
specified as part of security group rules.
Hyperv Neutron agent always takes 0.0.0.0/0 as the remote Ip address by
default which is now fixed so that we will be able to specify
more restrictive security group rules using remoteIp prefix.

Closes-Bug: #1443862

Change-Id: I497aea5d803bba69f52eef19c0f9c743e678e6d7
'}]
commit_message:
Hyperv agent does not respect remoteIpPrefix

Fixes Hyperv issue where Hyperv agent does not respect the remoteIp prefix
specified as part of security group rules.
Hyperv Neutron agent always takes 0.0.0.0/0 as the remote Ip address by
default which is now fixed so that we will be able to specify
more restrictive security group rules using remoteIp prefix.

Closes-Bug: #1443862

Change-Id: I497aea5d803bba69f52eef19c0f9c743e678e6d7

subject: Lower default backup_metadata_version to 1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-30 14:05:19.000000000', 'files': ['rpc_deployment/inventory/group_vars/cinder_all.yml'], 'message': 'Lower default backup_metadata_version to 1

Kilo cinder supports both version 1 and 2, however juno cinder only
supports version 1.  Running
tempest.api.volume.admin.test_volumes_backup against a juno cinder
installation w/ backup_metadata_version set to 2 results in the
following cinder-backup error being logged:

BackupOperationError: Metadata restore failed due to incompatible
                      version

Partial-bug: #1399386
Change-Id: I20852c5fb331d9cbd297ecbd60a2b57d4fa37266
'}]
commit_message:
Lower default backup_metadata_version to 1

Kilo cinder supports both version 1 and 2, however juno cinder only
supports version 1.  Running
tempest.api.volume.admin.test_volumes_backup against a juno cinder
installation w/ backup_metadata_version set to 2 results in the
following cinder-backup error being logged:

BackupOperationError: Metadata restore failed due to incompatible
                      version

Partial-bug: #1399386
Change-Id: I20852c5fb331d9cbd297ecbd60a2b57d4fa37266

subject: Improve error message from unreadable Heat template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-29 14:05:46.000000000', 'files': ['rally/benchmark/scenarios/heat/stacks.py'], 'message': 'Improve error message from unreadable Heat template

Formerly, the error message for an unreadable Heat template was always
the same, regardless of why it was unreadable; the original error was
simply discarded. This includes the original error in the exception
that is reraised from _get_template_from_file() so that the end user
might have a better idea of what the problem is.

Change-Id: Ic5e773ca1dd49c707c848cfe1dc6163e9bceb228
'}]
commit_message:
Improve error message from unreadable Heat template

Formerly, the error message for an unreadable Heat template was always
the same, regardless of why it was unreadable; the original error was
simply discarded. This includes the original error in the exception
that is reraised from _get_template_from_file() so that the end user
might have a better idea of what the problem is.

Change-Id: Ic5e773ca1dd49c707c848cfe1dc6163e9bceb228
