commit_message:
Change file loading mechanism for heat tests

Improve file loading mechanism for heat tests. Previously,
heat tests loaded template files for every tests. "types.set"
allows to exclude redundant file operations from tests.
In addition, the unit tests for heat rally-scenarios were updated
and mocking of CONF.benchmark was excluded from unit-tests.

Change-Id: Ibdace7bf96ff822701ee8505f1dcd232999a6fe8

commit_message:
Support size range in Cinder create_volume and extend_volume

It is useful for some test cases to set up volume size from some
range, not only specific value. This change add such possibility
to create_volume and extend_volume.

Change-Id: Ic7cc9270eb8d31dcbe3d30acf6f24cf9c41a6fd1

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 18:36:21.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_auth/openstack/common/fileutils.py', 'openstack_auth/openstack/common/log.py', 'openstack_auth/openstack/common/_i18n.py', 'openstack_auth/openstack/common/policy.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I5bd1cdc35d2ecaf98a0802fff589d8c37aaa8028
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-12-17 19:53:23.000000000', 'files': ['spec/compute_spec.rb', 'attributes/default.rb', 'spec/nova-common_spec.rb'], 'message': "Removed metadata from the nova service list.

The metadata service is now handled by it's own service
(openstack-nova-metadata-api) and thus does not need to
be included in the main nova-api process.

This resolves occasional race condition where
openstack-nova-metadata-api starts before
openstack-nova-api and prevents the nova api from
starting.

Change-Id: Ie665593aaffecdf43008489f21f3e4ab55e985f8
"}]
commit_message:
Removed metadata from the nova service list.

The metadata service is now handled by it's own service
(openstack-nova-metadata-api) and thus does not need to
be included in the main nova-api process.

This resolves occasional race condition where
openstack-nova-metadata-api starts before
openstack-nova-api and prevents the nova api from
starting.

Change-Id: Ie665593aaffecdf43008489f21f3e4ab55e985f8

commit_message:
Removed tempest git entry

The tempest role has an entry within the defaults of the role and
it could cause confusion when dealing with tempest as the main
package version is being specified in
`vars/repo_packages/openstack_services.yml`. Being that these
variables are no longer used they have been removed.

Implements blueprint: master-kilofication
(cherry picked from commit bddfa51fce403d84dd9a2ae9f9fa1baf7f582dbc)


Change-Id: I197afac1ce50d9bad778dda5cc4a23a0821fceeb

commit_message:
Revert state if attachment already exists

When attach is called twice for the same volume and instance the
attach_volume checks if the attachment already exists and returns.
This leaves the volume in 'Attaching' state. The volume status should
be reset to 'in-use' if we see the attachment already exists.

Change-Id: I2a2d28de59af234300082ab4655b0bc10699d54c
Closes-Bug: #1449980
(cherry picked from commit 709949d904c7f1d0e13b41bf6723d71bcf6b5652)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-30 21:34:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Fix assert on call count for encodeutils.safe_decode mock

Commit c084b9d57ce8def5a20159364c16290ad67ad0a5 added a global call to
encodeutils.safe_decode in oslo.log 1.1.0 which can mess up the strict
call_count check on the mock in this test.

This prevents nova from updating requirements.txt to use oslo.log >=
1.1.0 so we have to change the test to be less restrictive about the
mock call count here.

We just check the calls to the mock and make sure that at least two
calls were made where the errors='ignore' kwarg was passed, which is
what _create_domain does.

Change-Id: I68d41c2713ad558112c35e4a35af39a4ef3bdec6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix assert on call count for encodeutils.safe_decode mock

Commit c084b9d57ce8def5a20159364c16290ad67ad0a5 added a global call to
encodeutils.safe_decode in oslo.log 1.1.0 which can mess up the strict
call_count check on the mock in this test.

This prevents nova from updating requirements.txt to use oslo.log >=
1.1.0 so we have to change the test to be less restrictive about the
mock call count here.

We just check the calls to the mock and make sure that at least two
calls were made where the errors='ignore' kwarg was passed, which is
what _create_domain does.

Change-Id: I68d41c2713ad558112c35e4a35af39a4ef3bdec6

commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Ifa8baab33cdb3e606cf175a8c29c3a4ef6c44480

commit_message:
Update Backup and Restore section for NFS driver

Kilo adds support for use of an NFS exported backup repository
alongside Swift, Ceph, and TSM.

This update provides information in the Backup and Restore section
of the Cinder chapter of the Administrator's Guide on configuration
settings for the NFS backup driver.

Change-Id: I7754e640dd5d33e9c7afc664d4dbc5e4fddde7a7

The InstanceInfoCache save method calls db.instance_info_cache_update
to update the database and receives an updated sqlalchemy model as a
return value. However, the result isn't saved to the self.fields of
the InstanceInfoCache object, though it is sent to update cells,
which is inconsistent. It doesn't seem critical as we expect to

Change-Id: I64be855a194990f898ce4e572f42975a07bf1d3c

commit_message:
Update self with db result in InstanceInfoCache.save

The InstanceInfoCache save method calls db.instance_info_cache_update
to update the database and receives an updated sqlalchemy model as a
return value. However, the result isn't saved to the self.fields of
the InstanceInfoCache object, though it is sent to update cells,
which is inconsistent. It doesn't seem critical as we expect to
receive mostly the same data back from the database as we already
have, except for the "created_at" and "updated_at" fields.

Change-Id: I64be855a194990f898ce4e572f42975a07bf1d3c

commit_message:
Decrease PO files for python projects

Remove untranslated strings and location information from PO files. The
location information is still in the POT files as reference for easy
regeneration using "msgmerge POTFILE POFILE -o COMPLETEPOFILE".

This moves the git add command to the end since compress_po_files
changes the files.

Change-Id: I8d9f80276085ffe4dd614960457637330ca28370

subject: Always call hdisk removal from vscsi volume driver
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8662, 'name': 'Kyle L. Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 12947, 'name': 'Sridhar Venkat', 'email': 'svenkat@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'svenkat'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 14532, 'name': 'Gerald McBrearty', 'email': 'gfm@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'gfm'}, {'_account_id': 14917, 'name': 'Dave Archer', 'email': 'dwarcher@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'dwarcher'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-01 12:39:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_vscsi.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/vscsi.py'], 'message': 'Always call hdisk removal from vscsi volume driver

This change updates the vscsi volume driver to ensure that the hdisk
removal is always invoked.  The hdisk removal significantly speeds up
subsequent discoveries.  The changes to pypowervm should remove risks
from running the API.

The change is done so that an error from the hdisk job does not block
volume disconnect.  The volume will have already been disconnected from
the VM by the time the command is run.  If the hdisk remove fails for
some reason, a subsequent attach should clean it up (but can be slower
when it does so).

Change-Id: Ib823f793ec4b951111301286743c6bd243b863fe
'}]
commit_message:
Always call hdisk removal from vscsi volume driver

This change updates the vscsi volume driver to ensure that the hdisk
removal is always invoked.  The hdisk removal significantly speeds up
subsequent discoveries.  The changes to pypowervm should remove risks
from running the API.

The change is done so that an error from the hdisk job does not block
volume disconnect.  The volume will have already been disconnected from
the VM by the time the command is run.  If the hdisk remove fails for
some reason, a subsequent attach should clean it up (but can be slower
when it does so).

Change-Id: Ib823f793ec4b951111301286743c6bd243b863fe

commit_message:
Fix pbr and it's version checks (unblock gates)

New version of pbr 0.11 was released and it checks
that version in setup.cfg is bigger then latest tag

To avoid future issues we will let pbr calulate version
instead of hardcode them in setup.cfg

Temporary disable coverage job to merge this patch

Partial-bug: #1450731

Change-Id: I0c00c231cea1a0506107133803406eb56694f690

commit_message:
remove XML middleware from default paste config

While this patch removes the xml_body middleware from the default paste
pipeline (thus failing against tempest tests which expect it), it
preserves support and functional test coverage for that middleware.

This is a softer step toward https://review.openstack.org/#/c/125738/

Change-Id: Ibd8020967ea89e6c8c8a55073e658f180faf1c00
Closes-Bug: 1384382
Closes-Bug: 1384789
Blueprint: removed-as-of-kilo

commit_message:
Publishers will eventually time out if consumer never reconnects

If a client dies after sending a request to the server, the server may
loop forever retrying to deliver the reply.

Added config rabbit_publish_timeout defaults to 0 sec, no timeout at all.

Change-Id: Id7fb72f88be675d17f47c958c32d1055f967b820

If there are VMs with Notes = None, the Hyper-V Driver cannot
start, as it tries to iterate over None, which results in an
exception.

This commit adds a check if the Notes exist, before iterating over
them.

Closes-Bug: #1438638

Change-Id: Icebdc03d7249fdf903b94b2f61f4891f5c9d6e50
'}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V: checks for existent Notes in list_instance_notes

If there are VMs with Notes = None, the Hyper-V Driver cannot
start, as it tries to iterate over None, which results in an
exception.

This commit adds a check if the Notes exist, before iterating over
them.

Closes-Bug: #1438638

Change-Id: Icebdc03d7249fdf903b94b2f61f4891f5c9d6e50

subject: Change ZeroMQ driver underlying pattern to REQ/REP
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 3211, 'name': 'zhangjialong', 'email': 'zhangjl@awcloud.com', 'username': 'zhangjl'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6488, 'name': 'Clint Byrum', 'email': 'clint@fewbar.com', 'username': 'clint-fewbar'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7805, 'name': 'Li Ma', 'email': 'skywalker.nick@gmail.com', 'username': 'Nick'}, {'_account_id': 13290, 'name': 'Oleksii Zamiatin', 'email': 'ozamiatin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ozamiatin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-07 15:41:58.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/zmq-req-rep.rst'], 'message': "Change ZeroMQ driver underlying pattern to REQ/REP

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/zmq-req-rep

Current zmq driver implementation is built over PUSH/PULL PUB/SUB socket patterns.
These kind of sockets are straight-forward one way directed.
So, to organize some backward replies (as CALL method does) we need to support
two socket pipelines PUSH/PULL for sending messages and subscribe for reply over PUB/SUB.

I assume that was made because of those days ZeroMQ restrictions.
Now we have two-directions socket types like REQ/REP (Request-Reply).
There is also ROUTER/DEALER async version of REQ/REP.
I'd like to propose to use this pattern in zmq driver.
This will reduce a second socket pipeline and a lot of surrounding code.

Change-Id: I5692e9db94c123d818b6ed63af70054ab1848336
"}]
commit_message:
Change ZeroMQ driver underlying pattern to REQ/REP

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/zmq-req-rep

Current zmq driver implementation is built over PUSH/PULL PUB/SUB socket patterns.
These kind of sockets are straight-forward one way directed.
So, to organize some backward replies (as CALL method does) we need to support
two socket pipelines PUSH/PULL for sending messages and subscribe for reply over PUB/SUB.

I assume that was made because of those days ZeroMQ restrictions.
Now we have two-directions socket types like REQ/REP (Request-Reply).
There is also ROUTER/DEALER async version of REQ/REP.
I'd like to propose to use this pattern in zmq driver.
This will reduce a second socket pipeline and a lot of surrounding code.

Change-Id: I5692e9db94c123d818b6ed63af70054ab1848336

commit_message:
Allow complex filtering with embedded dicts

Allow filtering of searchable data to be done with multiple levels
of dict data, rather than only simple types (string, int, etc).
Two tests are added for testing a dict within the filtering dict,
and a dict within a dict within the filtering dict (to test the
recursive aspect).

Change-Id: I17562bfe6bf5cb6a0dc48c4a693fe755200eee08

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-23 11:47:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha.py'], 'message': 'Spawn RADVD only in the master HA router

Currently radvd is spawned in all the HA routers irrespective of the
state of the router. This approach has the following issues.

1. While processing the internal router ports (i.e., qr-xxx), ha_router
   removes the LLA of the interface and adds it as a VIP to Keepalived conf.
   Radvd daemon is spawned after this operation in the router namespace
   (if the port is associated with any IPv6 subnets). Radvd notices that
   qr-xxx interface does not have the LLA, so does not transmit any Router
   Advts. In this state, VMs fail to acquire IPv6 addresses because of the
   missing RAs. Radvd does not recover even after keepalived configures the
   LLA of the interface. The only solution is to restart/reload radvd daemon.
   Currently keepalived-state-change monitor does not do any radvd related
   operations when a state transition happens. So we endup in this state
   forever.
2. For all the routers in Backup state, qr-xxx interface does not have LLA
   as it is managed by keepalived and configured only on the Master HA router.
   In such agents syslog is flooded with the messages [1] and this can cause
   loss of other useful info.
   [1] - resetting ipv6-allrouters membership on qr-2e373555-97

This patch implements the following.
1. If the router is already in the Master state, we configure the LLA as a VIP
   in keepalived conf but do not delete the LLA of the internal interface.
2. We spawn radvd only if the router is in the Master State.
3. Keepalived-state-change monitor takes care of enabling/disabling radvd upon
   state transitions.

Closes-Bug: #1440699
Change-Id: I351c71d058170265bbb8b56e1f7a3430bd8828d5
'}]
commit_message:
Spawn RADVD only in the master HA router

Currently radvd is spawned in all the HA routers irrespective of the
state of the router. This approach has the following issues.

1. While processing the internal router ports (i.e., qr-xxx), ha_router
   removes the LLA of the interface and adds it as a VIP to Keepalived conf.
   Radvd daemon is spawned after this operation in the router namespace
   (if the port is associated with any IPv6 subnets). Radvd notices that
   qr-xxx interface does not have the LLA, so does not transmit any Router
   Advts. In this state, VMs fail to acquire IPv6 addresses because of the
   missing RAs. Radvd does not recover even after keepalived configures the
   LLA of the interface. The only solution is to restart/reload radvd daemon.
   Currently keepalived-state-change monitor does not do any radvd related
   operations when a state transition happens. So we endup in this state
   forever.
2. For all the routers in Backup state, qr-xxx interface does not have LLA
   as it is managed by keepalived and configured only on the Master HA router.
   In such agents syslog is flooded with the messages [1] and this can cause
   loss of other useful info.
   [1] - resetting ipv6-allrouters membership on qr-2e373555-97

This patch implements the following.
1. If the router is already in the Master state, we configure the LLA as a VIP
   in keepalived conf but do not delete the LLA of the internal interface.
2. We spawn radvd only if the router is in the Master State.
3. Keepalived-state-change monitor takes care of enabling/disabling radvd upon
   state transitions.

Closes-Bug: #1440699
Change-Id: I351c71d058170265bbb8b56e1f7a3430bd8828d5

subject: Update pyScss and django-pyscss
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-01 01:43:41.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Update pyScss and django-pyscss

pyScss <1.3 has an ordering bug which results in @imports
being included in semi-random order. This breaks the ordering
of the CSS parts of bootstrap, which breaks some critical
elements of bootstrap.

Change-Id: I77d6f41fe7c9617298484969220f6fdfe82c3c36
Depends-On: Idec7ce039b57476ce20b7b678431459c2ca0bdbf
'}]
commit_message:
Update pyScss and django-pyscss

pyScss <1.3 has an ordering bug which results in @imports
being included in semi-random order. This breaks the ordering
of the CSS parts of bootstrap, which breaks some critical
elements of bootstrap.

Change-Id: I77d6f41fe7c9617298484969220f6fdfe82c3c36
Depends-On: Idec7ce039b57476ce20b7b678431459c2ca0bdbf

commit_message:
Added branch creation to yaql ACL

To comply with the new governance for libraries yaql has to define
stable branches.
This patch allows yaql-release team to create new stable branches and
yaql-milestone team to maintain them.

Change-Id: If15ab12ffabe035b676fb46dabe46531689244ab

commit_message:
neutron subnet-create requires args at the end

The network name must be next to the CIDR otherwise `neutron
subnet-create` gets confused.

Change-Id: Ie8b19d3824e5e25f80c61f0794595813c80b98da

commit_message:
devstack: Give example of custom ovs git repo.

Provide an example of how to configure a custom OVS git repo.  This is
useful at the moment as the latest patches to make OVN work are not
all merged, so you may want to test from a branch that has them
applied already.

Change-Id: Ic1cacbee2d05c0889d2cc10f0d96d0fa1f45d60e

commit_message:
devstack: Fix git repo name assumptions.

Some parts of the devstack plugin assumed the git repo would always be
ovs.git.  Make it figure that out from the git repo URL.

Change-Id: I05764b6d55571b33a9ffed5eb687804d16021c50

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 8662, 'name': 'Kyle L. Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 12947, 'name': 'Sridhar Venkat', 'email': 'svenkat@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'svenkat'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 14532, 'name': 'Gerald McBrearty', 'email': 'gfm@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'gfm'}, {'_account_id': 14917, 'name': 'Dave Archer', 'email': 'dwarcher@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'dwarcher'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-30 17:25:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vios.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vios.py'], 'message': 'Use the active WWPNs for connections

The initial code was gathering all of the FC ports for certain
operations.  This could lead to very long delays as the inactive ports
would run operations, and would eventually time out.

This change will only return the active ports for the VIOSes, resulting
in faster operations when dealing with storage.

Change-Id: I5c10e8e91ef6936f6c6c44644de54db3b18a41d5
'}]
commit_message:
Use the active WWPNs for connections

The initial code was gathering all of the FC ports for certain
operations.  This could lead to very long delays as the inactive ports
would run operations, and would eventually time out.

This change will only return the active ports for the VIOSes, resulting
in faster operations when dealing with storage.

Change-Id: I5c10e8e91ef6936f6c6c44644de54db3b18a41d5

There was recently a thread on openstack-dev titled "A big tent home

The thread began here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-April/062310.html

and has roughly ended up here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-April/062853.html

commit_message:
Add notes about official sub-projects.

There was recently a thread on openstack-dev titled "A big tent home
for Neutron backend code."

The thread began here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-April/062310.html

and has roughly ended up here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-April/062853.html

This patch is an attempt to reflect the end of that thread with
updates to docs.

Any further discussion should just continue on openstack-dev to avoid
forking the discussion between openstack-dev and gerrit.

Change-Id: I48dbe8ac69e60fbfd5e5082844004aaf9fdce539

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-20 17:28:15.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/default-disable-services.rst'], 'message': 'Default Service Node Status to Disabled

At the PHL Operators meetup, the large deployments group concluded new compute
capacity should be disabled by default. The group cited production issues
where instance failures were caused by untested compute provisioning. Disabling
new services by default is safer and allows operators to fully test
new before releasing it for use.

blueprint disable-compute-default

Change-Id: I29d5b3cf55985cd007a86cc7c507bd589d1e0f0b
'}]
commit_message:
Default Service Node Status to Disabled

At the PHL Operators meetup, the large deployments group concluded new compute
capacity should be disabled by default. The group cited production issues
where instance failures were caused by untested compute provisioning. Disabling
new services by default is safer and allows operators to fully test
new before releasing it for use.

blueprint disable-compute-default

Change-Id: I29d5b3cf55985cd007a86cc7c507bd589d1e0f0b

additional search-and-match logic in bindep we should just respect
this platform quirk.

commit_message:
Change ironic maintenance method to align with power method

Upon obtaining a better understanding of the Ironicclient and Ironic
API interaction, along with what is actually returned, which should
be None, it makes sense to have set_machine_maintenance_state match
set_power_state in behavior.

Change-Id: I2899f290c0521e35d010dc9246b590ca9e949214

commit_message:
Add Ironic machine power state pass-through

Adding machine power state passthrough in the form of
a _set_machine_power_state method, along with wrapper methods
set_machine_power_on, set_machine_power_off and
set_machine_power_reboot.

Tests to utilize the on, off, and reboot methods have been
which all invoke the _set_machine_power_state method.

Change-Id: I4e1ce863d5a93d81ec90ae1c244cbfef68912916

subject: Change apache service to restart
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-21 14:42:57.000000000', 'files': ['labs/scripts/ubuntu/setup_horizon.sh', 'labs/scripts/setup_lbaas_controller.sh'], 'message': 'Change apache service to restart

After fixing the apache service issue with Ubuntu14.04, restart
command should work better that manual stop/start. While stopping
and starting a service using scripts, it can sometimes be too fast
to give time to the service to respond properly and cause error
status and more races.

Change-Id: I84b2271f07a10ce1a29403312736272221895c35
'}]
commit_message:
Change apache service to restart

After fixing the apache service issue with Ubuntu14.04, restart
command should work better that manual stop/start. While stopping
and starting a service using scripts, it can sometimes be too fast
to give time to the service to respond properly and cause error
status and more races.

Change-Id: I84b2271f07a10ce1a29403312736272221895c35

subject: Allow for int or string ID comparisons
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-30 13:49:32.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_shade.py', 'shade/__init__.py'], 'message': "Allow for int or string ID comparisons

Some IDs are clearly strings (e.g., UUIDs) and some look like integers
(e.g., flavor ID of '100'). Let's make it easy for a user by allowing
for string or int. For example:

    flavor = cloud.get_flavor(100)

or

    flavor = cloud.get_flavor('100')

The former example using the int doesn't work, but this fixes that.

Change-Id: If201352a9917d7c8fba7b386b38fced9949f00a9
"}]
commit_message:
Allow for int or string ID comparisons

Some IDs are clearly strings (e.g., UUIDs) and some look like integers
(e.g., flavor ID of '100'). Let's make it easy for a user by allowing
for string or int. For example:

    flavor = cloud.get_flavor(100)

or

    flavor = cloud.get_flavor('100')

The former example using the int doesn't work, but this fixes that.

Change-Id: If201352a9917d7c8fba7b386b38fced9949f00a9

subject: Basic infrastructure for HA Guide conversion to RST
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-04 04:23:13.000000000', 'files': ['doc/ha-guide/locale/ha-guide.pot', 'doc/ha-guide/setup.py', 'doc/ha-guide/source/conf.py', 'doc/ha-guide/source/index.rst', 'doc/ha-guide/setup.cfg', 'tox.ini', 'doc/ha-guide/source/intro.rst'], 'message': 'Basic infrastructure for HA Guide conversion to RST

The High Availability Guide is being rewritten and the team
has chosen to use RST.  This patch puts the infrastructure in
place.  Existing content will be improved and moved over, and
new content will be added here rather than the docbook.

The tox.ini file excludes this content from being published at
this time.

Change-Id: If72e0b89ce1b561bce4439b4811256b620856954
'}]
commit_message:
Basic infrastructure for HA Guide conversion to RST

The High Availability Guide is being rewritten and the team
has chosen to use RST.  This patch puts the infrastructure in
place.  Existing content will be improved and moved over, and
new content will be added here rather than the docbook.

The tox.ini file excludes this content from being published at
this time.

To generate the HA guide, use:  tox -e ha

Change-Id: If72e0b89ce1b561bce4439b4811256b620856954

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-02 15:19:50.000000000', 'files': ['xstatic/pkg/angular/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Correct LICENSE tag.

Set LICENSE to MIT as per https://github.com/angular/angular.js/blob/master/LICENSE.

The license name is in the SPDX format (https://spdx.org/licenses/),

commit_message:
Correct LICENSE tag.

Set LICENSE to MIT as per https://github.com/angular/angular.js/blob/master/LICENSE.

The license name is in the SPDX format (https://spdx.org/licenses/),
OSI approved, and thus Open https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Open

Bump build #.

Change-Id: I74558c0cd6a771bb83fefabbc14cd182d4fa0b45

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-30 19:38:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth/service_catalog.py'], 'message': 'Remove region_name from service catalog

This would allow you to save a region_name on the catalog so that all
your responses were relative to that region_name. This was deprecated,

Change-Id: Idd7a62a6ce44c3697f62939038d0322482f1e527
'}]
commit_message:
Remove region_name from service catalog

This would allow you to save a region_name on the catalog so that all
your responses were relative to that region_name. This was deprecated,
if you want to search by region name you have to provide it.

Change-Id: Idd7a62a6ce44c3697f62939038d0322482f1e527

commit_message:
Remove the AccessInfo Factory

Replace it with a create that is much simpler.

I did this as a standalone method rather than a classmethod as I don't
think it really applies to the current class.

Change-Id: I3dad2359e1956ddbb16486445fe6c04814d50fa0

commit_message:
Remove region_name from catalog

This was used to affect the urls that were returned from the catalog.
This should never have been here and is deprecated.

Change-Id: I320e3801ba045f4608baef246e9a48fa4c743421

commit_message:
Adds config files to Install and configure storage nodes

Configuration files for container-reconciler and object-expirer
 are not provided during the swift install. This commit adds
 them to the install and configure storage node components section.

Change-Id: Iccc33509f0917652c686e9e0f1baa23cbde2f7bc
Closes-Bug: #1437185

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-30 12:17:26.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_plugin_builder/fuel_plugin_builder/actions/create.py', 'fuel_plugin_builder/fuel_plugin_builder/validators/schemas/__init__.py', 'fuel_plugin_builder/fuel_plugin_builder/validators/schemas/v1.py', 'fuel_plugin_builder/fuel_plugin_builder/validators/schemas/v2.py', 'fuel_plugin_builder/fuel_plugin_builder/consts.py', 'fuel_plugin_builder/fuel_plugin_builder/tests/test_create.py', 'fuel_plugin_builder/fuel_plugin_builder/validators/schemas/base.py'], 'message': 'Add checking for name during plugin creation

Currently plugin builder can verify correctness only

Closes-Bug: #1439760
'}]
commit_message:
Add checking for name during plugin creation

Currently plugin builder can verify correctness only
after plugin was created. It gives to user possibility
creates plugin with incorrect name. This fix provides
validation for name on creation stage.

Change-Id: Ib54313fac6b246288838e48ce483046e47a5a7bb
Closes-Bug: #1439760

Dell SC driver calls out the wrong REST API version

On initialization of the session with the Dell REST
API the dell api version was incorrectly specified.
It should be 2.0 rather than 1.5.

Closes-Bug: #1446868

commit_message:
Context: is_admin==True implies is_advsvc=True

With this change is the is_admin parameter is set to True when
creating a context, the is_advsvc property is set to True as well,
without executing a pointless check with policy engine.

Closes-Bug: #1450244

Change-Id: I0a21a82692665599260d07c00c55df18fc926eb5

before cluster creating and updating, size related validation will

TODO:
  - Do size validation before node adding/deleting/migrating
  - Do size validation before cluster scaling

commit_message:
Add min_size and max_size properties to Cluster

This patch added min_size and max_size properties to Cluster. Now
before cluster creating and updating, size related validation will
be done by comparing min_size/max_size/desired_capacity.

TODO:
  - Do size validation before node adding/deleting/migrating
  - Do size validation before cluster scaling
  - Heat stack update need support from SDK

Change-Id: Ibf792f5152f7bd5ada53ec7755bbe92616dbdcd5
Implements: blueprint add-size-limitation-properties-to-cluster

commit_message:
Adding "requires" to "task-defaults" clause

* Reverse workflows can now use "requires" declared in
  "task-defaults", for example, to have all tasks
  depending on a configured task (except this task itself)
* Fixed a bug with "processed" flag, it shouldn't be taken
  into account for reverse workflows because if say task3
  depends on task2 then these tasks can't depend on a task1
  at the same time

Change-Id: Iad113e405f43125b37d16b91fcf448c21cd354e6
(cherry picked from commit fa0102354b6fd5f865fc33eb2f703f658bfe98b1)

* Fixed a bug with "processed" flag, it shouldn't be taken

Change-Id: Iad113e405f43125b37d16b91fcf448c21cd354e6

commit_message:
Adding "requires" to "task-defaults" clause

* Reverse workflows can now use "requires" declared in
  "task-defaults", for example, to have all tasks
  depending on a configured task (except this task itself)
* Fixed a bug with "processed" flag, it shouldn't be taken
  into account for reverse workflows because if say task3
  depends on task2 then these tasks can't depend on a task1
  at the same time

Change-Id: Iad113e405f43125b37d16b91fcf448c21cd354e6

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-15 04:44:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': "Fix binding:host_id for neutron on evacuate

Currently when doing an evacuate the neutron host_id binding for
the port isn't updated.

Currently in rebuild_instance() we call
self.network_api.setup_networks_on_host() but this doesn't actually
do anything for neutron.

For neutron the cleanest fix would be to change rebuild_instance()
to call self.network_api.setup_instance_network_on_host() but this
might break nova-network.

So as a test we're going to modify neutron's
setup_networks_on_host() to act the same as
setup_instance_network_on_host().  Hopefully this won't cause
problems elsewhere.

Change-Id: I5e420075400afbe064231be38f06438f48dd1178
Closes-Bug: #1444171
"}]
commit_message:
Fix binding:host_id for neutron on evacuate

Currently when doing an evacuate the neutron host_id binding for
the port isn't updated.

Currently in rebuild_instance() we call
self.network_api.setup_networks_on_host() but this doesn't actually
do anything for neutron.

For neutron the cleanest fix would be to change rebuild_instance()
to call self.network_api.setup_instance_network_on_host() but this
might break nova-network.

So as a test we're going to modify neutron's
setup_networks_on_host() to act the same as
setup_instance_network_on_host().  Hopefully this won't cause
problems elsewhere.

Change-Id: I5e420075400afbe064231be38f06438f48dd1178
Closes-Bug: #1444171

commit_message:
Compatibility fix for pyscss 1.3.4

This commit alters the action-list.scss file so it is compatible
with the newer version of pyScss (1.3.4+), allowing us to
upgrade to that version.

This change is a prerequisite for the update to get into the
global requirements so that that change can pass testing.

Change-Id: Idec7ce039b57476ce20b7b678431459c2ca0bdbf
Co-Authored-By: Kelly Domico <kelly.domico@hp.com>

commit_message:
Rename _discover module

_discover was private in keystoneclient because there was a circular
dependency. All the functions within have always been public as they
were imported into the keystoneclient.discover file.

Rename now we don't have to worry about our imports.

Change-Id: I4b6afcefd1376f8d2d0a8d2f602f967a1febf3f1

_output_hosts_file(). However patch

commit_message:
Remove Debug Traces from _output_hosts_file

On the stable/juno branch, bug #1414218 should have been fixed
by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164329 (merged April 1st).
This patch removed LOG.debug statement from for-loop of method
_output_hosts_file(). However patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/153181 (also merged April 1st)
added LOG.debug statements to the for-loop of the same method.
The result is bug 1414218 isn't fixed on the stable/juno branch.
In order to have bug 1414218 fixed on the stable/juno branch the
LOG.debug statements in the for-loop of _output_hosts_file is
removed.

Change-Id: I7e620443d9835b65d276c1aed055cffc3bf4f13b
related-bug: #1414218
closes-bug: #1445202

Prevent false positives of UPDATE_COMPLETE in integration tests

false positives of UPDATE_COMPLETE.

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-30 13:00:59.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/aws/lb/loadbalancer.py'], 'message': 'Add timeout hidden parameter to AWS LB

Current implemenatation contains WaitCondition resource with timeout
equal 600. It is enough for fast hardware, unortunatelly thre are some
situation when need more time for downloading and installation all
related packages. As good example can be used our Heat gate job,
where provisioning one vm take more then 10 minutes.
This patch add paramater for WaitCondition timeout. Now it can be used
to change wait time for provisioning instance with all necessary packages.

Change-Id: Id80b2655f7e218cf884b86838d28588b865a5e56
'}]
commit_message:
Add timeout hidden parameter to AWS LB

Current implemenatation contains WaitCondition resource with timeout
equal 600. It is enough for fast hardware, unortunatelly thre are some
situation when need more time for downloading and installation all
related packages. As good example can be used our Heat gate job,
where provisioning one vm take more then 10 minutes.
This patch add paramater for WaitCondition timeout. Now it can be used
to change wait time for provisioning instance with all necessary packages.

Change-Id: Id80b2655f7e218cf884b86838d28588b865a5e56

commit_message:
Enable SecurityGroups property for AWS LB resource

AWS LB has SecurityGroups property, but it's not implemented.
This patch adds turn on this option by using SecurityGroups in nested
template as parameter and property for AWS::EC2::Instance.

Change-Id: I922cc97291179c79d1451a38cbb9e16933d703ef
Closes-Bug: #1443947

subject: Support for ISO images in OpenStack Configuration Reference is incorrect
revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2015-04-30 11:08:46.000000000', 'files': ['doc/config-reference/image-service/section_image-service-ISO-support.xml'], 'message': 'Support for ISO images in OpenStack Configuration Reference is incorrect

The instructions for how to build instances with ISO images is
incorrect in config-reference/iso-support. Following the original
instruction, users are unable to create functional instances, they
will stuck at system installation and rebooting.

This patch addes instructions about how to use ISO images to create
functional VMs without any third party softwares (just OpenStack).

Change-Id: I6c03cb8f7a6e5ca5a30a4f78b26965c47b7c397a
Closes-Bug:#1448894
'}]
commit_message:
Support for ISO images in OpenStack Configuration Reference is incorrect

The instructions for how to build instances with ISO images is
incorrect in config-reference/iso-support. Following the original
instruction, users are unable to create functional instances, they
will stuck at system installation and rebooting.

This patch addes instructions about how to use ISO images to create
functional VMs without any third party softwares (just OpenStack).

Change-Id: I6c03cb8f7a6e5ca5a30a4f78b26965c47b7c397a
Closes-Bug:#1448894

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-03-12 00:43:28.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/identity/admin/v3/test_trusts.py'], 'message': "Create a new project for trusts tests

The trusts tests were originally being done in the project that the admin
client is scoped to. Change this to creating a new project as this will fail if
the admin client is scoped to a domain instead of a project.

Also specify domain information when creating users and projects. If not
specified the default domain for create_user and create_project is 'default',
however if not specified at authentication time the default user domain is
CONF.identity.admin_domain_name - which may not be default.

Change-Id: I4ab3383f48894d00c1b59abdb97ab483e6ca5270
"}]
commit_message:
Create a new project for trusts tests

The trusts tests were originally being done in the project that the admin
client is scoped to. Change this to creating a new project as this will fail if
the admin client is scoped to a domain instead of a project.

Also specify domain information when creating users and projects. If not
specified the default domain for create_user and create_project is 'default',
however if not specified at authentication time the default user domain is
CONF.identity.admin_domain_name - which may not be default.

Change-Id: I4ab3383f48894d00c1b59abdb97ab483e6ca5270

Changing dictionary size while using iterator causes RuntimeError. This
can happen in local vlan mapping under certain program flows. This patch
changes iteritems() to values() that returns list and thus preventing
from failure if local vlan mapping changes during creating tunnels.

Change-Id: I8a858d5c53e85f83a582f34205f9afa214cb4d58
Closes-Bug: 1449944
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use iterator in search for tunnel type

Changing dictionary size while using iterator causes RuntimeError. This
can happen in local vlan mapping under certain program flows. This patch
changes iteritems() to values() that returns list and thus preventing
from failure if local vlan mapping changes during creating tunnels.

Change-Id: I8a858d5c53e85f83a582f34205f9afa214cb4d58
Closes-Bug: 1449944

subject: Cleanup fixed_name logic in test_list_server_filters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-17 00:50:19.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/servers/test_list_server_filters.py'], 'message': 'Cleanup fixed_name logic in test_list_server_filters

This commit cleans up the logic for determining the fixed network name
to use for test list server filters. Previously it had an unnecessary
if block to handle the case where getting a network name failed. This
simplifies the logic to just use a get() on the dictionary which will
default to false.

Change-Id: I356124459610342c8f7906397e23d58cbfad99bb
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup fixed_name logic in test_list_server_filters

This commit cleans up the logic for determining the fixed network name
to use for test list server filters. Previously it had an unnecessary
if block to handle the case where getting a network name failed. This
simplifies the logic to just use a get() on the dictionary which will
default to false.

Change-Id: I356124459610342c8f7906397e23d58cbfad99bb

of following code-files:

- trove/guestagent/volume.py

commit_message:
Update pod manifest parsing according to v1beta3

Now that Kubernetes 0.15.0 release is supported and it has
v1beta3, the manifest structure has changed from v1beta1 to
v1beta3. This change implements the v1beta3 manifest parsing
logic.

Change-Id: Iaebe9fa29ba81d4f49a1b9fb1a547757b96520da
Partially-Implements: blueprint python-k8sclient

subject: Remove the is_id boolean check for domains
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-28 01:06:48.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/heat_keystoneclient.py', 'heat/tests/test_heatclient.py'], 'message': 'Remove the is_id boolean check for domains

The _stack_domain_is_id is a boolean that tells you if the value in
self.stack_domain is a name or id value.

This is clunky. Replace it with just saving the id or name into their
own variables as None values in auth plugins are ignored.

Change-Id: I9f6ec6b414174870317aa167e3c953c6844ccab9
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the is_id boolean check for domains

The _stack_domain_is_id is a boolean that tells you if the value in
self.stack_domain is a name or id value.

This is clunky. Replace it with just saving the id or name into their
own variables as None values in auth plugins are ignored.

Change-Id: I9f6ec6b414174870317aa167e3c953c6844ccab9

commit_message:
Allow instances to attach to shared external nets

Allow non-admin tenants to attach instances to external networks
from Neutron if the networks are also marked as shared.

Conflicts:
	nova/network/neutronv2/api.py
	nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py

Closes-Bug: #1413837

commit_message:
Refactored barbican.py for better testability

We heavily refactored barbican.py and its respective
tests in order to ensure better testing practices.
The tests no longer rely on executing through cliff.
Cliff was responsible for suppressing errors.

Change-Id: I820c90a0d197d6470b36b5767b9f983572a7ff0f

commit_message:
Install packages from plugin.sh

The plugin installs redis packages when needed but it doesn't do the
same for mongodb. This patch makes sure the required mongodb packages
are installed.

subject: Correct the tag merge script logic
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-30 20:44:29.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/merge_tags.sh'], 'message': 'Correct the tag merge script logic

The previous iteration did not take into account that the most
recent tag on master is likely to have been a release candidate, and
therefore have the same major+minor value as the incoming release.
Also tags pushed to non-stable branches should be skipped.

Change-Id: I339df1d88ddaedb193b1b246a2c21a433c11495c
'}]
commit_message:
Correct the tag merge script logic

The previous iteration did not take into account that the most
recent tag on master is likely to have been a release candidate, and
therefore have the same major+minor value as the incoming release.
Also tags pushed to non-stable branches should be skipped.

Change-Id: I339df1d88ddaedb193b1b246a2c21a433c11495c

commit_message:
Add apps needed for a CI/CD pipeline.

Attis-- wrapper app that deploys and configures the CI/CD infrastructure
OpenLDAP-- openLDAP app; Create user jenkins/openstack for authentication
Gerrit-- Gerrit app that uses OpenLDAP for authentication; create user gerrit
Jenkins-- Jenkins app that uses OpenLDAP for authentication

Change-Id: I583e574717d86aa081d1c1755d14acd831ec04ca

commit_message:
Ignore non-numerical releases in highest_semver.py

Now that we are no longer using alpha releases, we don't need to process
non-numerical version numbers. Ignore anything that we can't convert to
a sequence of integers.

Change-Id: Idf18bcd841f9fd435641211b773574c2d85a1694

subject: Download of translations not properly disabled in APT
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-25 19:24:24.000000000', 'files': ['elements/dpkg/root.d/60-block-apt-translations'], 'message': "Download of translations not properly disabled in APT

The wrong APT config name is used to disable download of translations.
It's Acquire::Languages, not APT::Acquire::Languages.

Change-Id: Ie0c12d444bab19b4486845944ef51031e9133470
Closes-bug: #1436523
"}]
commit_message:
Download of translations not properly disabled in APT

The wrong APT config name is used to disable download of translations.
It's Acquire::Languages, not APT::Acquire::Languages.

Change-Id: Ie0c12d444bab19b4486845944ef51031e9133470
Closes-bug: #1436523

commit_message:
Add apps needed for a CI/CD pipeline.

Attis-- wrapper app that deploys and configures the CI/CD infrastructure
OpenLDAP-- openLDAP app; Create user jenkins/openstack for authentication
Gerrit-- Gerrit app that uses OpenLDAP for authentication; create user gerrit
Jenkins-- Jenkins app that uses OpenLDAP for authentication

Change-Id: I6eafbf845f5161d54d9a12e755fcab00c1916e11

Move the files to packages subdirectory

commit_message:
Corrects order of parameters to assertEqual

The correct order of parameters to assertEqual is (expected,
actual).
It makes the assertion message more meaningful when there is
a failure.

Closes-Bug: #1277104

subject: Default glance swift_backend to use local swift
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-30 16:35:51.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'etc/openstack_deploy/user_secrets.yml', 'etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_glance/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': 'Default glance swift_backend to use local swift

The default values should use the local swift installation, since these
are only used when the glance backend is set to "swift" it won't matter
if there is no local swift when the backend is set to "file".

Adjust AIO script to use the defaults.

Move the configuration values from user_secrets.yml into
user_variables.yml since these are not passwords that should be set.
Additionally comment them out by default.

Change-Id: I579500a0287bc29f27fdbdb4f810212a2e194dea
Closes-Bug: #1450117
(cherry picked from commit fafd3add3727d45c1cb82afa5438efa9d41ad7c5)
'}]
commit_message:
Default glance swift_backend to use local swift

The default values should use the local swift installation, since these
are only used when the glance backend is set to "swift" it won't matter
if there is no local swift when the backend is set to "file".

Adjust AIO script to use the defaults.

Move the configuration values from user_secrets.yml into
user_variables.yml since these are not passwords that should be set.
Additionally comment them out by default.

Change-Id: I579500a0287bc29f27fdbdb4f810212a2e194dea
Closes-Bug: #1450117
(cherry picked from commit fafd3add3727d45c1cb82afa5438efa9d41ad7c5)

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-04-29 23:04:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': "Eliminate extra queries used to retrieve gw_ports

The _get_sync_routers method was calling get_routers and
then getting the gateway ports from the db in a separate
get_ports call. This extra call is unnecessary since is
already an SQL relationship directly between the router
and it's gw_port.

This patch eliminates all of the additional gw_port retrieval
logic by replacing the get_routers call with a _get_collection
call to make use of the gw_port object already present on
each router object.

Change-Id: I478bfef8b0273b343aa72bcd6787a486eba4f006
Partial-Bug: #1445412
"}]
commit_message:
Eliminate extra queries used to retrieve gw_ports

The _get_sync_routers method was calling get_routers and
then getting the gateway ports from the db in a separate
get_ports call. This extra call is unnecessary since is
already an SQL relationship directly between the router
and it's gw_port.

This patch eliminates all of the additional gw_port retrieval
logic by replacing the get_routers call with a _get_collection
call to make use of the gw_port object already present on
each router object.

Change-Id: I478bfef8b0273b343aa72bcd6787a486eba4f006
Partial-Bug: #1445412

commit_message:
Update CORS tests to use config fixture's load_raw_values

The newer version of oslo_config contains a method that allows
us to load raw values into our fixture directly. This patch updates
the relevant unit tests to use this method instead of the manual
load/clear it was doing previously.

Change-Id: I415bed500995c389c4a4bcf9787609a806562018

commit_message:
Revert "Temporarily copy proposed/* ACLs to stable/kilo"

Remove the stable/kilo temporarily release management ACL sections
but don't restore the old proposed/* sections since they're no
longer needed either. At least in spirit....

This reverts commit 639ec1d17e77be63204ddce1851d179de27cd424.
This reverts commit fb04574fc07c13f933aba9e9addc731ec9d6bb2a.
This reverts commit 774f236cf4386435e90f02fb28669c37ed97c2bf.

Change-Id: Ifb5e8ec6175ad0623db9e3c02883255c98149dab

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 9550, 'name': 'Eugeniya Kudryashova', 'email': 'ekudryashova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ekudryashova'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10618, 'name': 'Pavel Kholkin', 'email': 'p.v.holkin@mail.ru', 'username': 'pkholkin'}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-11 14:28:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/network/test_manager.py'], 'message': "Add VLAN to network meta if applicable

Certain compute drivers need to determine the VLAN for a VIF at plug
time.  This need can be seen by the existing VMware driver and others
that separate out VIF logic based on Neutron or Nova network.  This
goes against the purpose of the nova network API abstraction, which is
meant to hide if the admin is using Neutron or Nova backed networks.

This change set provides the VLAN to be included (if applicable) on the
VIF's network object (meta section).  It is not included if the
network's type is not VLAN.  This change supports both nova network
and neutron networks.

By putting this metadata in the VIF's network object, it avoids the
issue where certain drivers are:
 - Detecting which network is being used
 - Invoking specific operations against that network client to gather
   the needed data

This change does not update the drivers themselves, but rather lays the
foundation so that these drivers can take advantage of it.  Subsequent
change sets are required for platform driver utilization.

Change-Id: I6187428caa04d8a7fd878c7d7ff11fd84c656cab
"}]
commit_message:
Add VLAN to network meta if applicable

Certain compute drivers need to determine the VLAN for a VIF at plug
time.  This need can be seen by the existing VMware driver and others
that separate out VIF logic based on Neutron or Nova network.  This
goes against the purpose of the nova network API abstraction, which is
meant to hide if the admin is using Neutron or Nova backed networks.

This change set provides the VLAN to be included (if applicable) on the
VIF's network object (meta section).  It is not included if the
network's type is not VLAN.  This change supports both nova network
and neutron networks.

By putting this metadata in the VIF's network object, it avoids the
issue where certain drivers are:
 - Detecting which network is being used
 - Invoking specific operations against that network client to gather
   the needed data

This change does not update the drivers themselves, but rather lays the
foundation so that these drivers can take advantage of it.  Subsequent
change sets are required for platform driver utilization.

Change-Id: I6187428caa04d8a7fd878c7d7ff11fd84c656cab

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-30 17:19:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/fixtures.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vios.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vios.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/disk/test_localdisk.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_npiv.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_vscsi.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/vscsi.py'], 'message': 'Optimize the VIOS specification in driver

This change optimizes the use of the VIOSes in the driver.  It does so
by:
 - Removing an excess call to capture the VIOSes in the driver start up.
 - Querying only for the active VIOSes within the vscsi volume driver.

This not only makes the code run quicker, it is also more correct
functionally.  It no longer tries to connect to VIOSes that may be down
for maintenance purposes.

Change-Id: I718752385837c021c8d0f429ab71f4f7e27c0dd6
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize the VIOS specification in driver

This change optimizes the use of the VIOSes in the driver.  It does so
by:
 - Removing an excess call to capture the VIOSes in the driver start up.
 - Querying only for the active VIOSes within the vscsi volume driver.

This not only makes the code run quicker, it is also more correct
functionally.  It no longer tries to connect to VIOSes that may be down
for maintenance purposes.

Change-Id: I718752385837c021c8d0f429ab71f4f7e27c0dd6

subject: Compare each chunk of large objects when uploading
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 9216, 'name': 'Joel Wright', 'email': 'joel.wright@gmail.com', 'username': 'jjw-sohonet'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-24 01:36:51.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_service.py', 'swiftclient/multithreading.py', 'swiftclient/service.py', 'tests/unit/utils.py', 'tests/functional/test_swiftclient.py'], 'message': 'Compare each chunk of large objects when uploading

Previously, we compared the ETag from Swift against the MD5 of the
entire large object. However, the ETag for large objects is generally
the MD5 of the concatenation of the ETags for each segment, unless the
object is a DLO whose segments span more than one page of a container
listing. Rather than worry about ETags, just compare each chunk of the
segmented file. This allows the use of --skip-identical when uploading
SLOs and DLOs.

Additionally, there are several test-related improvements:
 * The default arguments for OutputManager are now evaluated on
   construction, rather than on definition, so that
   TestOutputManager.test_instantiation will succeed when using nosetest
   as a test runner. (See also: bug 1251507)
 * An account_username option is now available in the functional tests
   config file for auth systems that do not follow the account:username
   format.
 * CaptureOutput no longer writes to the captured stream, and
   MockHttpTest now captures output. These were polluting test output
   unnecessarily. (See also: bug 1201376)

Change-Id: Ic484e9a0c186c9283c4012c6a2fa77b96b8edf8a
Closes-Bug: #1201376
Closes-Bug: #1379252
Related-Bug: #1251507
'}]
commit_message:
Compare each chunk of large objects when uploading

Previously, we compared the ETag from Swift against the MD5 of the
entire large object. However, the ETag for large objects is generally
the MD5 of the concatenation of the ETags for each segment, unless the
object is a DLO whose segments span more than one page of a container
listing. Rather than worry about ETags, just compare each chunk of the
segmented file. This allows the use of --skip-identical when uploading
SLOs and DLOs.

Additionally, there are several test-related improvements:
 * The default arguments for OutputManager are now evaluated on
   construction, rather than on definition, so that
   TestOutputManager.test_instantiation will succeed when using nosetest
   as a test runner. (See also: bug 1251507)
 * An account_username option is now available in the functional tests
   config file for auth systems that do not follow the account:username
   format.
 * CaptureOutput no longer writes to the captured stream, and
   MockHttpTest now captures output. These were polluting test output
   unnecessarily. (See also: bug 1201376)

Change-Id: Ic484e9a0c186c9283c4012c6a2fa77b96b8edf8a
Closes-Bug: #1201376
Closes-Bug: #1379252
Related-Bug: #1251507

commit_message:
Revert state if attachment already exists

When attach is called twice for the same volume and instance the
attach_volume checks if the attachment already exists and returns.
This leaves the volume in 'Attaching' state. The volume status should
be reset to 'in-use' if we see the attachment already exists.

Change-Id: I2a2d28de59af234300082ab4655b0bc10699d54c
Closes-Bug: #1449980

commit_message:
Zone ownership tests

* There are three tenants: default, alt, and admin
* Updated config to grab creds for each tenant type
* Reworked clients to make tenant selection simple within test cases
* Added zone ownership test cases
* A bit of other refactoring to put code in more sensible places

Change-Id: I5330b2b1f81ac896300f199b341775594ab14073

The sha's for a few of the services had some last minute changes that
were merged into kilo before the tag as such all of the release entries
have been updated for today's release.

The update-revision.sh script was forward ported from juno into kilo
to ensure that there are no "user errors" when updating kilo in future
revisions.

Implements blueprint: master-kilofication

Change-Id: I3716f3d268475959527237cad98b06dafc1125be
'}]
commit_message:
Updated release versions for Kilo

The sha's for a few of the services had some last minute changes that
were merged into kilo before the tag as such all of the release entries
have been updated for today's release.

The update-revision.sh script was forward ported from juno into kilo
to ensure that there are no "user errors" when updating kilo in future
revisions.

Implements blueprint: master-kilofication

Change-Id: I3716f3d268475959527237cad98b06dafc1125be

commit_message:
Change keystoneclient to keystoneauth in docs

This was simply the result of:

find -type f | xargs sed -i 's/keystoneclient/keystoneauth/g'
find -type f | xargs sed -i 's/python-keystoneauth/keystoneauth/g'

in the docs directory to fix the build failure.

Will look at a doc rewrite soon.

Change-Id: I05d4be12f31ea47e917dc79e50d17b174bf89938

commit_message:
Fix translation building and publishing

The translated RST guides were not moved to the publish directories,
move them over for publishing.

Also fix draft publishing for guides that use /draft like install-guide
and config-reference.

Change-Id: Ia80ffc2ab1825d4c1a6b16eef0df39ae28e0c77c

commit_message:
Improvements to README.rst of elements

Improve the formatting of README.rst of elements:
- proper syntax for bash snippets
- improve list formatting
- use list definitions for environment variariables
- remove the explicit bash usage from diskimage-create.sh invocations
- wrap lines at 80 characters
- various small text formattings

Change-Id: I93b4c35b31dac66af22663b2cec426a08fa73bd8

The test test_create_dvr_fip_interfaces_for_restart_l3agent_case was
causing a file fip-linklocal-networks to be created when the tests are
run, this patch ensures that the correct part of the LinkLocalAllocator
is patched to prevent this in the test case.

Change-Id: Ifd0cae56324364b281a9279047b26a182b77905a
Closes-Bug: 1450090
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure mocks for lla allocator _write in test_agent

The test test_create_dvr_fip_interfaces_for_restart_l3agent_case was
causing a file fip-linklocal-networks to be created when the tests are
run, this patch ensures that the correct part of the LinkLocalAllocator
is patched to prevent this in the test case.

Change-Id: Ifd0cae56324364b281a9279047b26a182b77905a
Closes-Bug: 1450090

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-11 02:55:51.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/data_processing/jobs/templates/data_processing.jobs/config_template.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/data_processing/jobs/workflows/launch.py'], 'message': 'Sahara Data Processing EDP Job Add HBase common lib checkbox

HBase applications written in Java require JARs on the HBase classpath.
Java actions launched from Oozie may reference JARs stored in hdfs
using the `oozie.libpath` configuration value, but there is no
standard HBase directory location in hdfs that is installed with Oozie.
By adding checkbox in the create cluster and job execution page, sahara
provided an option to build the directory at cluster launch time, and also
provided the common hbase lib when executing hbase edp job.

spec -https://review.openstack.org/#/c/155899/

partially implements bp: edp-add-hbase-lib

Change-Id: I3f4e11479402784a2a010e06109beb8066eec3aa
'}]
commit_message:
Sahara Data Processing EDP Job Add HBase common lib checkbox

HBase applications written in Java require JARs on the HBase classpath.
Java actions launched from Oozie may reference JARs stored in hdfs
using the `oozie.libpath` configuration value, but there is no
standard HBase directory location in hdfs that is installed with Oozie.
By adding checkbox in the create cluster and job execution page, sahara
provided an option to build the directory at cluster launch time, and also
provided the common hbase lib when executing hbase edp job.

spec -https://review.openstack.org/#/c/155899/

partially implements bp: edp-add-hbase-lib

Change-Id: I3f4e11479402784a2a010e06109beb8066eec3aa

commit_message:
Fix exponentially growing AJAX updates for table rows

Schedule next table rows update only when the last row was
updated. Since unit-test for this fix relies on a blueprint
replace-qunit-tests-with-jasmine it is moved to a separate commit to
speed up this fix merge, see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/179013/

Change-Id: Id603a4fde5713d8f2b85b1dcf72c82c93a87c755
Closes-Bug: #1263665

Currently, a keystone IdP does not provide the domain of the project
when generating SAML assertions. Since it is possible to have two
projects with the same name but in different domains, this patch
adds an additional attribute called "openstack_project_domain"

commit_message:
Add openstack_project_domain to assertion

Currently, a keystone IdP does not provide the domain of the project
when generating SAML assertions. Since it is possible to have two
projects with the same name but in different domains, this patch
adds an additional attribute called "openstack_project_domain"
in the assertion to identify the domain of the project.

Closes-Bug: 1442343
bp assertion-extra-attributes

Change-Id: I62ed73d87f268c73294738845421deb87088326b

commit_message:
Fix _device_to_port_id for non-tap devices

This adjusts the _device_to_port_id function in ML2
to recognize other interfaces that belong to Neutron
under different name prefixes.

Adds unit tests to achieve full converage of _device_to_port_id
method.

Closes-Bug: #1443710
Change-Id: I80284ee67e5876cf5689e49e1592ca1351ae5fa1

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-30 14:55:30.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "devstack: Change tunnel encap to geneve.

The current OVN code only allows geneve or stt for tunnels between

Change-Id: Ia5f9d7c562dc3a80637e7b47aadf455f2e2f85b1

commit_message:
devstack: Change tunnel encap to geneve.

The current OVN code only allows geneve or stt for tunnels between
hypervisors.  vxlan is allowed only with gateways (which aren't
supported yet).

Change-Id: Ia5f9d7c562dc3a80637e7b47aadf455f2e2f85b1

Delete the following from the compute smoke tag, these are more
advanced things that should just be caught by full Tempest testing.

 - resize operations

 - all actions except hard reboot

Trim the rest of the tests if it looks like they are doing very

smoke tests per class.

Change-Id: Ib91db7204848e8c0892f43251e8937dec6b23232
"}]
commit_message:
trim compute smoke tag

Delete the following from the compute smoke tag, these are more
advanced things that should just be caught by full Tempest testing.

 - resize operations

 - all actions except hard reboot

 - all use of proxy APIs (image / volume)

Trim the rest of the tests if it looks like they are doing very
related activities, which means we'll typically only have one or two
smoke tests per class.

Change-Id: Ib91db7204848e8c0892f43251e8937dec6b23232

commit_message:
Add a venv that can generate/write/update the states diagram

Instead of requiring manual understanding of how to generate
the states diagram, add an explicit virtualenv that can be
used to create and generate that docs diagram (and replace the
existing file with it).

Change-Id: I1738da9bf08bfda9b9be01489e8456569a31709e

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 6609, 'name': 'Elizabeth K. Joseph', 'email': 'lyz@princessleia.com', 'username': 'lyz'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-29 14:52:10.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/acls/stackforge/puppet-tripleo.config', 'gerrit/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Add tripleo-core to puppet-tripleo

Adds tripleo-core group to have rights on puppet-tripleo project. The
rights of puppet-manager-core group are kept. This project contains
Puppet code, but is solely used from the TripleO installer, so sometimes
it's not easy to find puppet-manager-core folks to do reviews for this
project to allow dependent changes in TripleO to land. We'd like to
share the permissions on this repository between the two core groups to
expand the number of interested core reviewers and allow an easier
progress on the TripleO Puppet work. The gerritbot is already set up to
notify both IRC channels.

Change-Id: I1f91f851b5800fdf69697fdd88fbd9e41349f6d1
"}]
commit_message:
Add tripleo-core to puppet-tripleo

Adds tripleo-core group to have rights on puppet-tripleo project. The
rights of puppet-manager-core group are kept. This project contains
Puppet code, but is solely used from the TripleO installer, so sometimes
it's not easy to find puppet-manager-core folks to do reviews for this
project to allow dependent changes in TripleO to land. We'd like to
share the permissions on this repository between the two core groups to
expand the number of interested core reviewers and allow an easier
progress on the TripleO Puppet work. The gerritbot is already set up to
notify both IRC channels.

Change-Id: I1f91f851b5800fdf69697fdd88fbd9e41349f6d1

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4428, 'name': 'Liyingjun', 'email': 'yinjalee@163.com', 'username': 'liyingjun'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6835, 'name': 'Kun Huang', 'email': 'gareth@openstacker.org', 'username': 'academicgareth'}, {'_account_id': 8507, 'name': 'Mikhail Dubov', 'email': 'mdubov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'msdubov'}, {'_account_id': 8576, 'name': 'Yair Fried', 'email': 'yfried@redhat.com', 'username': 'yfried'}, {'_account_id': 8840, 'name': 'Carlos L. Torres', 'email': 'carlos.torres@rackspace.com', 'username': 'carl6796'}, {'_account_id': 10475, 'name': 'Alexander Maretskiy', 'email': 'amaretskiy@mirantis.com', 'username': 'maretskiy'}, {'_account_id': 12395, 'name': 'Roman Vasylets', 'email': 'pomeo92@gmail.com', 'username': 'rvasilets'}, {'_account_id': 13609, 'name': 'Pavel Boldin', 'email': 'pboldin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'pboldin'}, {'_account_id': 14817, 'name': 'Mirantis Rally CI', 'email': 'rally-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ci50'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 26, 'created': '2015-04-29 11:23:58.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/common/test_streaming_algorithms.py', 'samples/tasks/sla/create-and-delete-user.json', 'rally/benchmark/sla/base.py', 'samples/tasks/sla/create-and-delete-user.yaml', 'tests/unit/benchmark/sla/test_base.py', 'rally/common/streaming_algorithms.py', 'rally-jobs/rally.yaml'], 'message': 'Add streaming algorithms and SLA to check for outliers

In the common.streaming_algorithms module, we add the base for the streaming
algorithms that take values from the input stream and compute certain
quantities needed for the benchmark results processing. These algorithms
should use constant memory and be able to scale.

Two streaming algorithms for computing mean and standard deviation are implemented.

There is also a new "max_outliers" SLA that checks for the maximum number of
outliers based on the mean and standard deviation of the durations, computed
using these new streaming algorithms. By default, the outliers are detected
only when the total number of iterations reaches 10 (can be configured).

Example:
  3.1 4.2 3.6 4.5 2.8 3.3 4.1 3.8 4.3 2.9 10.2 11.2 3.4

  has 2 outliers (10.2 and 11.2), so:
    {"outliers": {"max": 2}} -> PASS
    {"outliers": {"max": 1}} -> FAIL

Bonus:
  * Add gate testing of different SLAs with the Dummy scenario
  * Add samples for all SLAs
  * Fix detailed message for max_avg_duration

Change-Id: I7c4f77c418c7b61f71b43216110fa4c7aaccc2f5
'}]
commit_message:
Add streaming algorithms and SLA to check for outliers

In the common.streaming_algorithms module, we add the base for the streaming
algorithms that take values from the input stream and compute certain
quantities needed for the benchmark results processing. These algorithms
should use constant memory and be able to scale.

Two streaming algorithms for computing mean and standard deviation are implemented.

There is also a new "max_outliers" SLA that checks for the maximum number of
outliers based on the mean and standard deviation of the durations, computed
using these new streaming algorithms. By default, the outliers are detected
only when the total number of iterations reaches 10 (can be configured).

Example:
  3.1 4.2 3.6 4.5 2.8 3.3 4.1 3.8 4.3 2.9 10.2 11.2 3.4

  has 2 outliers (10.2 and 11.2), so:
    {"outliers": {"max": 2}} -> PASS
    {"outliers": {"max": 1}} -> FAIL

Bonus:
  * Add gate testing of different SLAs with the Dummy scenario
  * Add samples for all SLAs
  * Fix detailed message for max_avg_duration

Change-Id: I7c4f77c418c7b61f71b43216110fa4c7aaccc2f5

pinger pacemaker service on primary and secondary controllers.

commit_message:
Replace unnecessary call to get_sync_routers

Replaces a call to get_sync_routers with a single-column
router DB query in a method that doesn't use any of the
gateway information get_sync_routers spends extra
time populating.

Change-Id: I35eae975209316aad6b2c97c909dce385729864d
Partial-Bug: #1445412

commit_message:
install 'cinder-volume' package prior enabling 'cinder-volume' service

- astute deployment task enable_cinder.pp tries to start 'cinder-volume'
  service prior package 'cinder-volume' installation on Ubuntu

Change-Id: I4b233304830c28d6a6849b972ca90f9a54650b9c
Closes-bug: #1449093

commit_message:
Adding FunctionalMixin class

This is a class that implements basic unittest assert methods
and make base.Context and base.Scenario subclasses of it, so
now we can use base.assertX() methods in both classes.
This will be part of the Functional framework

Change-Id: I8e57a61ef6ec3ac0f090e3841bb9478bbc133834

commit_message:
Prohibit invalid ids in subtree and parents list

Do not allow passing invalid project_ids (None or non-existent) in
the list_project_parents() and list_projects_in_subtree() methods.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Erickson Santos <erickson@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Closes-Bug: 1425113

Change-Id: Ie0e281d60b358f551828555c3e21e3ccb18deecb

subject: Update tempest and AIO to test cinder backups
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 425, 'name': 'Darren Birkett', 'email': 'darren.birkett@gmail.com', 'username': 'darren-birkett'}, {'_account_id': 7307, 'name': 'Matt Thompson', 'email': 'mattt@defunct.ca', 'username': 'mattt416'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 7414, 'name': 'David Wilde', 'email': 'dwilde@redhat.com', 'username': 'd34dh0r53'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-29 20:55:11.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-tempest.sh', 'scripts/bootstrap-aio.sh', 'playbooks/roles/os_tempest/templates/tempest.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_tempest/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_tempest/templates/openstack_tempest_gate.sh.j2'], 'message': 'Update tempest and AIO to test cinder backups

This commit allows tempest to be configured to test the cinder backup
service.

Additionally, we:

- add a new function to openstack_tempest_gate.sh so we can include
  some cinder-backup-related API tests in our test list
- update bootstrap-aio.sh to enable cinder backups and the ability to
  test cinder backups
- update run-tempest.sh to include the cinder backup tests in the

commit_message:
Update tempest and AIO to test cinder backups

This commit allows tempest to be configured to test the cinder backup
service.

Additionally, we:

- add a new function to openstack_tempest_gate.sh so we can include
  some cinder-backup-related API tests in our test list
- update bootstrap-aio.sh to enable cinder backups and the ability to
  test cinder backups
- update run-tempest.sh to include the cinder backup tests in the
  default test list

Change-Id: I2b8b0255ef5fdf747bbc136c7b1152896161f8a0
Closes-Bug: #1449427
(cherry picked from commit be0169ac5b94c3c24b80d3b2176e681df57da0f7)

commit_message:
Update cinder.conf for cinder-backup

This change updates the way we write cinder.conf when cinder backups
are enabled.  If cinder_service_backup_swift_auth is set to 'per_user',
we do not set any url/user/key/tenant options in the config.  However,
if cinder_service_backup_swift_auth is set to 'single_user' then all
auth-related options will be written.  Some additional variables were
added to allow 'single_user' to work properly.

Note that backup_swift_url is actually the swift storage URL if using
'per_user', or your auth URL if using 'single_user'.

Partial-bug: #1399386
Change-Id: Ia9d2e140d629b1f7b4c668d2f6041f3c440ab826
(cherry picked from commit e1631dbace461491c02075e1a7ff1ab1d8f4283b)
(cherry picked from commit cd9680e4ed4e7834ef6eafce6bdb0f7366e007a5)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-29 04:11:18.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/plugin/test_kmip.py', 'barbican/plugin/kmip_secret_store.py'], 'message': 'Fixed Bug for KMIP Secret Storage

The KMIP secret store was incorrectly storing secrets. In some cases
this resulted in extra information being stored with the keys and in
other cases the key storage would fail with a 500 internal server
error.

This patch fixes the KMIP secret store to correctly store secrets.

Change-Id: I94944a05776d366bd33d46ddb25f7129425405d0
Co-authored-by: Kaitlin Farr <Kaitlin.Farr@jhuapl.edu>
Closes-Bug: #1449234
(cherry picked from commit 597869880f186ce951809fe85d5d7d0610f35c4f)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed Bug for KMIP Secret Storage

The KMIP secret store was incorrectly storing secrets. In some cases
this resulted in extra information being stored with the keys and in
other cases the key storage would fail with a 500 internal server
error.

This patch fixes the KMIP secret store to correctly store secrets.

Change-Id: I94944a05776d366bd33d46ddb25f7129425405d0
Co-authored-by: Kaitlin Farr <Kaitlin.Farr@jhuapl.edu>
Closes-Bug: #1449234
(cherry picked from commit 597869880f186ce951809fe85d5d7d0610f35c4f)

commit_message:
flagmappings: restore the AMQP settings split

Use multiple categories for oslo_messaging options (rpc, amqp, rabbitmq,
qpid, zmq) instead of a single rpc category.

This patch uses the autohelp script to generate tables and brings a few
other updates in the tables.

Partial-Bug: #1448119

Change-Id: I05476d97c20469c349b21404c49fccb9a9b77380
